text: Best Sushi and Bento menus in Henderson area. I will Def. Come back again.  You will not regret when u try out this  clean and neat place. Top notch sushi and more..
Service is excellent here. The staff was nice n helpful, sushi was fine. No regrets to give it a shot, having a fulfilled experience. Highly recommended.

Fresh ingredients, a really friendly staff that always treat everyone with the same genuine enthusiasm as the guy buying the most expensive sake and fish they offer. This place is an awesome spot for lunch or dinner! The only reason the taco spot next to them has never been tried..... remember Sushi Hiro with an I... not to be confused with the other spot with a similar name.

We walked in and got greeted very welcoming. Ordered many sushi rolls and bento box as well as many appetizers as tempera shrimp and gyoza. The sushi was so fresh and delicious.  
The best sushi I've had and I've been to quite a ton of sushi restaurants. 

I wish I could give this place 10 stars if I could. Fantastic food, super friendly staff and clean environment. It was perfect...
will defiantly be coming back and HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Hands down a five star restaurant, the chiefs are so welcoming and give a fine dining experience. They also were so accommodating to us as a family because I wanted to try something new and they totally walked me threw all the options and it came out absolutely amazing ! I would definitely recommend to al my friends and family , I drive just to have family night from summerlin.
This is an excellent sushi restaurant with ambience. Excellent service and quality sushi

Sushi Hiro was the best. Service was amazing. I went with my crew, ordered many rolls, appetizer, bento box, and dessert. 
Everything was delicious and tasty. Really recommend for everyone looking for real sushi, sashimi, and high quality foods and knowledgeable staff.

This place was amazing. The atmosphere is very comfortable, the wait staff very attentive and probably the most polite I've experienced. Then the food was not only a lot for the price but very fresh and everything tasted great. The sushi was incredible. We will make this a regular stop.

Best sushi weve found in Las Vegas so far. The sushi chef was amazing. The attention to details and willingness to make it the way we want was perfect. We will be back for sure! PS the fresh wasabi and wasabi honey mustard were delicious.

Finally!! My first review.  I have been a fan of YELP for years, I've just haven't had an experience worth a review.  Until now.    Wow!! How awesome is this place? And this review is strictly for delivery. (Can't wait to actually dine in ). Prices are well worth the quality.  We ordered  garlic edamame- sweet and delicious with the perfect kick of garlic.
Pork gyoza- very flavorful and hot
Seaweed salad-fresh and amazing
4 different sushi rolls- all delicious... Can't recall the names except the 007 roll. 
Long and satisfying story short, this place is great. I would recommend to anyone.    It can be pretty sketchy to order delivery,  especially from a Japanese / sushi spot. Food is packaged well and flavor was most definitely on point. Thank you to all at" Sushi Hiro ".

I could already tell the food here was going to be amazing when I stepped through the door and received a very enthusiastic greeting from the sushi chefs. You definitely get a bang for your buck here. Portions are a lot bigger than any other sushi place in Vegas. Ordered Takoyaki and it was ooyey gooey and just MELTED in your mouth. The Katsu Curry is very delicious too! The staff is super informative and friendly. Gosh I can't give this place enough praise. Got yourself a new regular here

As soon as I walked in I was promptly greeted by what felt like the entire floor staff. My waitress was Grace, she was very knowledgeable and made amazing recommendations. I ordered a couple rolls such as the plum tree roll, salmon lover, American dream, and Dragon rolls. I had the pleasure enjoying these rolls in a nice boat which was very very beautiful. The food tasted very good, no complaints at all. 

The place also has some good soothing music to match the beautiful Interior of the place. I had the pleasure of coming when the owner Hiro san was at the resturant. Very kind and knowledgeable. 

 Will come back again. One of the best Japanese resturants I have ever been to.

LOVED the o-toro and fresh scallop nigiri!  Chef Hiro has a great specials menu that shows what part of Japan the fish is from.  He always has something delicious looking on display on ice behind the bar.
Super fresh sushi ! Awesome and authentic !! Great service , a very great place to sit down and enjoy yourself!

Our new Sushi place!!!
Great decor 
Great service
Delicious food
Great prices too.
So happy we found this place. Thanks Yelpers for recommending

This is my new favorite sushi spot in town. Amazing quality, great portions and great service. The chirashi was wonderful with probably the best salmon I've had anywhere. 

The chef has another restaurant called Plum Tree in New York that is similarly great. Super thankful he expanded out here.

I came here a couple of times and thought the sushi was pretty fresh. I stepped in today with my mother and we both ordered udon noodle soups. My mother found a significant size piece of plastic in her broth. Once that happens to me at a restaurant the quality for the entire place becomes suspect. 
The waitress was sweet and tried to ease the situation, but the damage was already done. 

This is a competitive area with several great sushi restaurants. There's no room to make a mistake like this. Plenty of other options in Henderson that have consistent quality.

I walked in on opening night without knowing it was new. Everyone was super friendly; service was great. Prices are good for the serving size and they even customized my roll for me. Hope they do well!
We come for the bento box. Includes choice of protein, tempura, sushi roll, side salad and miso soup. And service is above and beyond. A must try.
The meal was excellent. I feel like I'm in Japan while dinning at Sushi Hiro.  Good food and great customer service.  Must try!!i
This place is awesome! The sushi is delicious, the wait staff attentive, and the atmosphere nice. I foresee them growing out of this space quickly.

We ordered two rolls which were very fresh and tasty. We also ordered the calamari appetizer, but it was very chewy--I was disappointed with this. I would return to the restaurant if I found myself in the area again.

Love this place. The food is fantastic and the quality is amazing. We got a free sample of their poke as well as a free dessert for their grand opening. Both were delicious. I will definitely be coming back....often!!!

Fantastic experience.  We came here with 3 kids in tow and as soon as we walked in the door we were welcomed by the entire staff.  Service was excellent and they went out of their way to make us feel like we've been coming for years.  The sushi quality is exceptional.  We started with a couple of oyster shooters with the quail eggs, and they were extremely well balanced.  Next up came the yellowtail jalape√±o, and it was beautifully presented.  We also had a caterpillar roll that was fantastic, and finally, a couple pieces of the nigiri toro.  That absolutely stole the show, it was some of the best toro I've ever had!   Great restaurant that focuses on quality.  If you're looking for AYCE this isn't your place but is definitely a contender for the best quality sushi in Henderson.

We met the owners of this location at the park in our neighborhood, so we knew we needed to try this place out. This place is authentic Japanese sushi unlike most sushi restaurant in Henderson. The dinning area is decorated so adorable and they have booths that offer some privacy while dinning. 

Beware their rolls are HUGE..which is not bad at all! Another great thing about this place is that they have a lot of pictures on the menu which always makes your decision easier. Upon request you can get fresh wasabi which if you have not tried yet (and you can handle the heat) you certainly need to request it. The servers and staff were all very friendly. They are also featured on a few food delivery apps and yelp delivery which is very convenient for a sushi night at home.

First time and not the last time.  Place very clean and bright.  Staff are very friendly. Cold green tea excellent and the glass was never empty.  Great food. Great sushi rolls. My new go to sushi restaurant even tho it is further away from where I usually go

Welcome to Eastern Ave. Hiro! My girlfriend and I ate there a few nights back, we have been hearing nothing but great things about this new sushi restaurant in the area so we had to try it. When we walked in we were greeted by the whole front of house staff as well as all the Sushi Chefs. When we sat down in the cozy booth we looked over the extensive sushi menu, everything in the sushi window looked very fresh so we knew we would be eating great! Our server came over and got our drink orders, she explained to us about the 5 course $46 menu that the sushi chef makes especially for you so we decided to go with this option. We were not disappointed by any means, everything tasted so fresh and the rice that was accompanied with the sushi was the best I've ever had.

If you are looking for an All You Can Eat sushi joint this will not be your place. Sushi Hiro takes pride in his rolls as well as the fresh seafood he offers at the restaurant. Thank you Sushi Hiro and staff for the awesome experience, we will definitely be back!

If you looking for great sushi with OPTIMAL customer service, Look no further. WOW, what an incredible atmosphere with great tasting food. The teriyaki chicken was smothered with a great sauce and a side of steaming veggies. This place really knows how to pamper the customer, they really get. They have won my sushi and  teriyaki chicken business! Thanks you guys, what a great experience.

Best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Always the freshest food. Very friendly staff, especially the ones behind the bar. I recommend sushi bar seating and ordering directly from the chef. Restaurant now open 7 days a week which is great because they used to close Sundays. Much much much better value than the likes of Nobu or other.

Sushi Hiro is such a hot spot these days. There is always a line for a table especially around lunch time. 

Lunch and dinner specials are really what make this sushi joint great. For a decent price the lunch and dinner specials come with a huge portion. The sushi and sashimi specials come with miso soup and salad. They have a chef selection of fishes and all are good quality. The bento specials come with an entree of your choice, miso soup, salad, selected tempura, and a california roll. So much food!

If you do not want to eat the lunch or dinner specials, you can order al la carte. However, I don't recommend doing this. Whatever fish I ordered in nigiri and sashimi was not the fish they brought out to me. They claim to have all these rare fishes, but when I order them, they always bring me "similar" fishes and not the exact one I order. Just beware of this so you don't get ripped off.

Update: The yellowtail cappacio is really good! Take note that they put a lot of the oil sauce so I would ask for light sauce.

This is a great sushi restaurant in Henderson. I've eaten at a lot of great sushi restaurants in Vegas and even Japan. This is not the best in either. But it's also not at that price point. The atmosphere is very cool. The staff were great and very attentive.  The price was awesome for what I got. Will I be back? You better believe it. My office is right across the street!

This restaurant deserves every star! I have eaten Japanese food around the world and this is some of the best! I had a lunch Bento box featuring Katsu chicken. Every element from the salad, miso soup, gyoza, spring roll, and tempura were excellent. Side dishes are often after thoughts at some restaurants but not here. Each was prepared as though it were the main course. There are traditional and non-traditional offerings here so you are sure to find something great! Prices are more than reasonable and portions were also generous. Don't miss this place!
Very good 2 ND time here and they are always good. I'm allergic to shell fish so I have to be careful, they are always kind and understanding. Always have a goodtime

This place it's racist went there im Hispanic and my girl is black they didn't welcome us or bring any menus to us for 20 min we left and nobody said anything it's 2017 people can't believe the staff in this place is so ignorant I will never come back or recommend this place To my  guests  I work in the hospitality business on the strip I will never send anybody to this racist place

I disliked pretty much everything about this place from the moment I walked in the door and had to duck underneath the fabric; to the food itself. The food was way too expensive for the quality that it is.  The screaming oh was the worst I've ever had. The shrimp Tempura roll had a very off flavor to it.  Both of the rolls that my husband ordered were not good either.  I will not be going back to this place. I'll stick to the tried-and-true like I love sushi or Momo sushi.  2 people 85.00 w/tip.  No thank you.

New favorite !!!
There's not any one thing that's really good about this place. Organic green tea, amazing food, service is outstanding. Our old go-to was I love Sushi but no more.
Sushi Hiro is excellent!!

I came here for lunch with my mom and godmom back in August 2017. We were greeted warmly by the staff, along with being promptly seated on a quiet day.

I ended up with the delicious charashi bowl, and I am pretty satisfied. Very fresh fish and muy ono~! Who know good sushi could still be had here in Vegas :) Words could not best describe the bliss i had with getting their fatty tuna sushi. It was extremely tender and practically melts in my mouth (consider I have teeth issues to chew faster). 

Although it's a bit pricey, what do you expect? It's definitely worth the quality seafood freshness here at Sushi Hiro! If the busy bustling vibe of The Strip gets too much, definitely make a trip out to here to veg out~

While I'm visiting from California, I came to SushiHiro instantly because of the amazing reviews on Yelp. I ordered the California Sunrise (Baked Salmon, avocado, cucumber, crabmeat, rice, seaweed, and some kind of homemade special creamy sauce.) This roll LITERALLY melted in my mouth. Without a doubt, best roll I have had in my life and definitely recommend it to others. The service was phenomenal, shoutout to my waiter BRIAN! He is the best!!!

this was seriously an amazing place, very unassuming from the outside. 

initially you are greeted with a loud Hazaa from everyone in the restaurant, which is so welcoming and fun. the design is perfect- super simple and elegant, while being fun! kind of looks like your in an upside down boat! 

as we were seated we were given hot towels to wipe our hands (very traditional Japanese we were told!) 

our server was incredible, very sweet and on top of everything, as were the bussers. 

I had three different sushi rolls, which were all amazing. the crispy rice appetizer was also so good! highly recommend trying this place out- and the tempura fried green tea ice cream was INCREDIBLE.
Went there for dinner. Place very clean, good customer service, amazing food. Price is fairly good. The sushi rolls pretty big, bento box have a lots of variations. Good variations of sushi also.

This is remarkable Sushi Restaurant in Las Vegas. 
As a Japanese, this is real Sushi I can say. 
I had "Ume" chef's choice 10 peace of Sushi for $46.
Look at photo.  It is real ! Not fake ! Try it!

I took a chance on this place trusting the overall rating and I was not disappointed. 

This place deserves much higher ratings than it has now. I have eaten at many very high end and high priced sushi bars and this ranks up with the very best. The chefs are two brothers and they are both very impressive as chefs. 

The quality was top notch with many choices fresh from Japan.

If you're staying on the strip, it is worth driving to this place as it delivers consistently better quality and without the ridiculously high prices. And servings are not microscopically small like they do on the strip to cut costs because their rent is so damn high. I'd say even better than Nobu or Zuma for a sushi purist.

What a wonderful place - delicious food, nice ambiance, fast and courteous service - all at reasonable prices. What more do you need after landing in Vegas and before a long drive to Zion?
Our whole family has loved everything here. We'll definitely come back if we happen to be in

At first we thought this AYCE but it wasn't. We went during lunch time and ordered bento boxes. They have huge serving. You get miso soup, salad, tempuras, rice, spring rolls, gyoza and the meat. They were affordable. We shouldn't have ordered special rolls if we knew they had huge servings. The rolls were sliced thinly compared to other places, fish of course is thinned. But tasted good. 

Negative side was our service was slow. We had to call the attention of our server for our drinks, orders, cheque.

For the price and serving, will come back

Randomly came across Sushi Hiro while on the east side of town and boy am I glad I did!  This was hands down the best/freshest sushi I have had in town. It makes me want to go back and take a few stars off other 5 star sushi places I rated, that is how incredible the food here was!  There were even beef and chicken dishes for my husband which puts it even higher on the list! 

I had to try the O-Toro special of the day, and I can honestly say I've never had fresher fish of any kind in my life!  While the price was a little higher, you definitely get when you pay for!  

As well, I had to get my staple salmon handroll, which has become how I judge a sushi restaurant, and this one was top notch!

My husband is probably lucky we don't live on this side of town, because I would be eating there way too often! :)
Super good for my first time trying! I've been looking for good sushi and I'm glad this place worked out! I got seaweed salad and the Fire Dragon Roll

Excellent service. Good food. Nice space.

My date and I decided on one roll and one small plate each - and we'd share everything.

We started with Yellowtail Carpaccio which was quite good and a very reasonable serving size. This would make a good main course for a lighter appetite.

Our two rolls were "Mermaid Roll" and "Plum Roll" (which, we were told, was the chef's specialty). Both were good, and were *huge*. 

We split an order of uni (sea urchin) which he liked more than I.

All in all - this was a *Lot* of food. Almost too much for two big guys. I would prefer smaller rolls - and then I'd get several, rather than one large roll each.  (Maybe they'll add a half-roll option?)

The total came out to what you would pay at any AYCE place, but the food quality was definitely a step up from that. 

Not blown away, but very good and certainly more than satisfactory. 

I would return for the lovely environment and excellent service.
A very nice typical Japanese place. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I recommend their Chirashi dinner, it is worth trying.
Consistently fresh Sushi is why I keep coming back to Sushi Hiro. Tempura Udon is really good. So far, Sushi Hiro is keeping up their standards. We shall see what happens next.

Not wanting to dine on "the strip" again I just googled for a sushi/sashimi restaurant and ran into Sushi Hiro. Me and my partner were starved so we ended up ordering 7 different dishes, from the chefs sashimi dinner combo, via shrimp tempura, over tuna jalapeno rolls and some more and EVERYTHING turned up AMAZING and delicious! After having dined in many $$$$ sushi and sashimi places all over the world sushi Hiro was a.delightful surprise! From the super friendly and goodhearted service through the obvious passion of the cooks preparing our dishes to the taste of it ALL! I can only recommend this place! Wow!

The best part of this restaurant is definitely the service. The staff that hosted us were attentive and kind, and did a great job making sure that my boyfriend and I were comfortable when we ate here. Unfortunately, I have to say that dining here was one of the worst sushi experiences I have had since I moved to Henderson. I do see that there are several wonderful reviews, so please don't let this review deter from you trying Sushi Hiro! However, my boyfriend ordered the Tour of Tokyo, and I ordered the 007 roll. Both rolls were tasty, but under-seasoned, and left much to be desired (especially since we were both craving sushi that night!) Our dinner was palliated by the amazing azuki mochi ice cream (red bean) which was smooth and perfectly sweet. But, it was made way worse when a few drunk restaurant attendees came out of the restaurant and kept standing in the path of our vehicle as we tried to leave (even after we asked them kindly to move)! They were clearly severely inebriated and I think that more attention should've been paid to them by their waiter/waitress in the restaurant (it's a safety thing, really!) In summary, we found that our service was wonderful, but I don't think we'll be back.
Very good . Great customer service . Even catered to altered menu items lol. Definitely has nice selection . My new spot for sushi and calamari for sure

In Vegas for a quick family get away.  We take my daughters best friend and she wants Sushi for lunch.  She wasn't crazy about the lady who took her order but I can tell you this, she said it was some of the best Sushi she has ever had  (it was good very fresh).  This is a child who eats a lot of Sushi.  My daughter agreed with her and was mad that she had gotten something else instead of Sushi.  Next time I'm in Vegas we will hit them up again.

The prices for sushi rolls are a little pricer than some other places, but there's definitely a difference in quality.  They have menu for fresh flown in items daily. Service is great. Would recommend it.

This is the spot where you can experience real sushi!!!!!!!!  Everything melts in your mouth.  I came with my girlfriend,  she said it was speechless.  All the chefs and servers are very friendly and they were on point.  Thumbs up!!!!  I don't think I can eat at other place no more....  Best sushi I ever had.  You just need to try it.

Great sushi and more importantly, very fresh. Omakase is probably the way to go - you get everything that's the freshest and you get the most variety. They have 3 different options depending on how hungry you are. This is worth the trip - a ways off the strip. Grab boba tea at Brew Tea bar nearby afterwards - probably the best boba outside of Taiwan in the US that I've tried so far. Can't go wrong with either.

One of the best Sushi places in town. This is a jewel in prime Sushi. It's not all you can eat just real authentic Japanese Sushi. This place will really satisfy you. We found a new spot for sure. Bomb!!!
DAMN.  This place is on a whole different level.  AMAZING QUALITY.  So fresh!  Calamari is the best I've ever had.  No AYCE but you will NOT care.  You must come here!  BEST IN TOWN!!!
Sushi was so so good. Staffs were very friendly. And their dessert was on fire... Love this place. We will definitely come back and try other items on their menu.
Love it, this is best sushi place with Kabuto in Vegas but prices are quite lower. Traditional sushi I will recommend it to any sushi lover

Service was very nice and attentive, and sushi was good. We saw families there for dinner, but the place did not disappoint in terms of providing fresh wasabi- which is something you don't find often in places that serve rolls. Fish tasted fresh. They also have an omakaze option, which I was hoping to try but the husband was not that hungry. 

I'd say it's a good place for date night too. ;)

Sweet shrimp.  Yes!!!!  This place has the best sweet shrimp I've ever had.  I won't tell you how they do it, but I could literally eat 20 of them.  This place has very unique rolls.  We tried very many of them.  We had the yellow tail carpaccio which was delicious and lots of nigiri.  I would recommend the nigiri the most due to the amazing quality.  While the rolls were fun, with fish quality THAT good, you really have to get nigiri.  They have a great variety of fish.  Not only that but they've got lots of other non sushi items on the menu, so feel free to bring your non sushi loving friend.  Everyone was so happy there and service was great.  When I am back in Vegas I will come back for sure.
We have been here several times. The food is always great. We like the creative rolls and how fresh the fish always is. A particular favorite roll is the California Sunrise.

Two Words: Up-And-Coming Restaurant

Chef Hiro and his brother are two of the most friendly people I have met in Vegas. From the moment you enter and the moment you leave, you are met with warm smiles and leave feeling quite satisfied. It is a fact that they know how to run a successful business as high-quality food and superior service is their standard.

Sit at the sushi bar to ogle the fresh fish where friendly conversation is well-received and returned.  Brian, Stella and the hostess are very knowledgeable of the menu and attentive to all guests. 

Appetizer: Fresh Salmon Spring Roll - This is light and refreshing. Salmon sashimi, shrimp, green salad, shiso leave, kaiware radish wrapped with rice paper. This is served with sweet sesame dipping sauce.

Roll:  Plum Tree - Tuna, salmon, and yellowtail wrapped in rice and topped with red, wasabi green and orange fish roe. The presentation was marvelous - I almost did not want to eat it because it was too beautiful! The flavors were rich and the crunchy texture of the roe paired well with the soft and creamy texture of the fresh salmon.

Dessert: Strawberry and Red Bean Ice Cream: Another beautiful presentation of lightly drizzled chocolate with mochi ice cream from the popular desert spot, Mikawaya (Los Angeles).

Chef Hiro and his brother recommended I try the Omakase ($45-65) - this seems to be the item of highest value as other high-end restaurants charge at least double of the price. 

If you are in the area and would like to be served high-quality fresh foods with top-notch service, stop by Hiro Sushi!

I am so late to writing this review, it's ridiculous. Hopefully the next time I pop by, Chef Hiro won't shoo me out the door for my oversight. In short, Sushi Hiro is the best sushi in Henderson!

I've only been by for lunch, where the omakase and chirashi prices are a bit lower. The dishes are consistently fresh, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. My go to is the chirashi bowl, and the chef is great about accommodating reasonable requests (no wasabi, no octopus, etc). Though they do offer a menu of rolls, I stick to their more traditional sushi options, which are simple but well executed. 

Note that you can order online to take your spectacular sushi feast home. I advise against this because of how great the dine-in presentation and service are, go when you can enjoy the whole experience! Highly recommend sitting at the bar to watch the action, but the private booths are nice too.
Super friendly and attentive service! I recommend the garlic edamame. Sushi Chef Hiro even made me a custom roll! We will be back!

Excellent service with friendly staff. The sushi was delicious and the food portions are perfect! We opted to sit at the sushi bar.  Chef Hiro was great. The restaurant itself is clean with a great atmosphere. Definitely will be coming back!

If your are in the area and looking for some fresh yummy sushi you need to start here!  The service here is great and the quality food is great as well. I will defiantly be back with some new clients asap!
This sushi place has now become a favorite!  Love the decor and love how fresh the sushi tastes!  Tried a new roll and loved it.  Will definitely come back again!

5 stars for the Omakase! 5 stars for Chef Hiro and his brother. 

New clean restaurant with quality fish. Definitely better than all other sushi spots in Henderson.

Very high quality sushi. The selection of special items varies daily. The chefs seem on the ball, and the wait staff is helpful and kind of funny. One tip - specify ice water or you might get hot water when asking for water to drink.

Sushi Hiro was way too AMAZING!! I loved "everything" about Sushi Hiro especially FOOD and SERVICES!! All the staff are very friendly. 

My friends and I went to road trip; Arizona, Utah, and Las Vegas. Let me tell you, the first three days that we spent at Arizona and Utah, we only had burgers... PURE burgers. We Asians miss rice so much. Then the last day we arrived at Las Vegas, Sushi Hiro was the first place that came to our mind and we were not hesitate to visit at all.  

We ordered a bunch of sushi. The rolls were placed in a big boat, pretty fancy, and all of the rolls were DELICIOUS. Every rolls became my favorite especially Out Of Control roll and Under Control roll. One of my friends also order off the bento menu. He said the bento was so good that he couldn't have enough! Overall, all the food was PREMIUM QUALITY. Service was FAST and ATTENTIVE. The interior and decoration were pretty. Great food with a good price deal. HIGH recommendation to try out this place and you won't be regret, believe me. Thank you Nami, Brian, and Chris so much for such a great services. We had a blast time. ^^
This place is amazing!! Delicious food a nice service. I highly recommend to anyone looking for good sushi

Establishment was having a "Grand Opening". The service was excellent & the staff was friendly. I feel that sushi is truly art & these sushi chefs made sure their rolls were no exception! Each platter was presented to us, beautifully. Each tasted very fresh.. My favorite was the 007 roll. We will be back. Glad we found this joint!

We popped in here on an impulse after grabbing some custard at Nielson's (also amazing). I am so happy this place is here now!! Easily one of the best sushi houses I've been to in Vegas: great quality, big selection, and really fair prices!

I got a couple nigiri (portions were larger than I expected, and tasted top notch), my girlfriend got chicken katsu and curry rice bowl (Curry Zen still has my heart, but this was also excellent!) and our friend got negimaki, which came out sizzling and tasted delicious.

Service was all really friendly, and I'll definitely be coming back!!! Henderson needed a good sushi house and it looks like we finally got one!

Great authentic sushi. I ordered dinner omakase and it was superb. Ordered appetizers which was ok. Could not care less for the spring rolls but my gf wanted it. She ordered the bento box and loved it. My omakase dinner were fat thick slices of delicious fresh fish. Server gave me a bowl of rice with omakase dinner. I checked in and got a free dessert which was flaming tempura ice cream, very good stuff. I'll visit again.

This place is spectacular.   Not only is the sushi delicious (try the funky roll), but the service is exemplary.  They bring you a hot towel before the meal.  The entire staff greets you when you arrive and wishes you well as you leave.   Truly a great experience.   Did I mention the sushi is fantastic?!

I can honestly say that Sushi Hiro is the best Japanese restaurant that I have ever eaten at.  The sushi was so PERFECT and so FRESH!  Very high quality and traditional Japanese food.  Their prices are very fair and match with the fine quality food.  It is a pleasure to eat there.  Everyone is so nice.  The service is great.  I will definitely be a regular customer!  Thank you to the owner and sushi chef, Hiro!  Can't wait to go back!

Update......  This is the BEST sushi in Henderson.  If you really like quality sushi and fish you can't find better in Henderson.  Very authentic with a special detail to the source of ingredients. 

This really is the best sushi place to open on Eastern.  We love I Love Sushi but this place blows it away on quality, freshness and portions for the price.  The restaurant has a great sushi bar and atmosphere to have a great sushi dinner.
Imo this is the best Sushi place in Henderson. Always fresh, and nice food portions and creative stuff. excellent.

Super white tuna 4/5
Snapper 5/5
Princess 4/5
American dream 4/5

Service: 5/5

They didn't have the best sushi I've ever had but their service is outstanding. They constantly checked up, smiled and interacted with my kids, and the food was fast. It's hard to find great service like this. Definitely will come back.
The fish was high quality and melted in your mouth! The sushi chef was super friendly! They ever have the traditional real wasabi! I highly recommend this place! Excellent sushi!!!!

Went in for lunch today. I got a chirashi bowl and my bf got a bento box. Everything from decor,atmosphere,service and food was amazing. We sat in the booth and it had a little curtain for a little privacy which I loved. The quality of fish is amazing! I think they have the best sushi in town. Will come back for sure and I guess this sushi joint will be my goto spot. :)

One of the best and most authentic sushi places in town.  The restaurant is kind of small and they weren't able to accommodate our party of 6...we had to wait about 20 mins and they had us sit in a 4 persons booth.  Service was slow at the beginning but once we ordered they were on top of things.  Food was really good and tasty.

Delicious sushi - fresh and big portions - so you're really getting your money's worth. Staff is very courteous, everyone greets you when you come in and leave. Positive and inviting environment for sure. Glad we tried a new place

The Exceptional + Knowledgable staff, High Quality product and welcoming environment calls us back constantly. This isn't just a neighborhood Sushi spot, it rivals AND exceeds "high-end" places on the strip. The fish is perfect, the Uni is always great, and Chefs selections are updated daily.  **Very Traditional**  Prices reflect the quality. This isn't all you can eat... nor should it be for this caliber of sushi.

Looking forward to many more visits.

My friend recommended Sushi Hiro and I'm glad my family and I went! The restaurant is so clean and waitress and Sushi  chefs are so welcoming!
The food is delicious!!!! I had the spider roll and uni...delicious! My husband had the omakase and was delicious! My kids had the teriyaki chicken  and beef teriyaki! They loved it! We highly recommend Sushi Hiro! Next time we come to Vegas we will come back!

This review is from the second and third time I come here within 2 weeks. LoL. 

The Chirashi dinner was good. Have more fishes but I think the lunch was a better value. 

Yuki-San was so generous. He went to our table and gave us a complimentary toro!! Thank you, Yuki-San!

I'm ordering the mussels again because it's THAT good! I'm so happy to come back to get the Chirashi! 

Took my husband on the third visit and he's getting the salmon lover roll and salmon teriyaki bento. YUM!!!

I've been coming here once a week now  and Yuki-San & Hiro-San always remember my order. They ARE the best sushi Chefs.

I ordered takeout last night from here & will never be back. My husband & I both have BAD food poisoning. We ordered a Philly roll & 007 roll, & while the food tasted good, I have never felt so ill in my life! I called & spoke with the manager right when they opened today & he was very apologetic & did issue a full refund. While I appreciate good customer service, I still wouldn't go back.

I am really impressed with this place. Everything I had was significantly above average in quality, at just average prices. Really good value.

The Chirashi lunch was awesome. I think it was around $16 and it totally filled me up. That is really amazing for that price. 

I would also really recommend the lunch and dinner bento. Can't say enough good things about everything here. 

Service and staff are great. When we were done with our meal we walked out to the car and as we were pulling out, the waitress ran up with our take-out box we forgot. We were parked pretty far away and in a hard to see spot, no idea how they tracked us down. They really go the extra mile for you.

I have to admit not a big fan of anything other then AYCE sushi. Sushi HIro never missed beat without the AYCE. Sometimes in sushi life not about quantity but quality. Although I only ordered one sushi roll (Crunchy Toro Special) from the daily special rolls. It was really really good. The fish quality was fresh and like the combination they came up with for the Crunchy Toro Roll). Not sure if maybe there thing or no doubt found the size of any of the speciality rolls HUGE. Basically your getting two or three extra pieces then regular sushi restaurant if ordered speciality roll. So warning if going specialty rolls two or three that LOT of food. The diversity of the speciality rolls is awesome. They literally have pictures of believe all the specialty rolls on the menu. Really not often seen full menu that literally every dish has picture with it. 

My entree ordered from the Dinner Bento Box and got the teriyaki chicken. They have few other protein options if going with the Bento Box. The thing that stood out for me. Most traditional Japanese restaurants that has the Bento or Box dinner on the menu. Not that big. The size at Sushi Hiro is pretty big. Literally every box is filled with food. It also come with miso soup and house salad. Both very tasty. The house salad nice fresh greens and the kicker was the salad dressing was awesome. I would buy bottle of that if they sold it. The teriyaki chicken was just ok. It could have been marinated longer or lacked distinct teriyaki flavor for me.

The service was five star. I came for dinner help celebrate another yelper Terri R birthday with other friends of hers. It was no big deal getting separate checks for party of seven. They were friendly, attentive, and nothing but five star service in my mind. 

The restaurant is small but love the interior decor. It very much your traditional style Japanese Restaurant. 

Not often on that side of town. Sushi Hiro is sushi spot that would hit up again!!!!

Speechless. Wow. Authentic sushi. High quality. Fresh. These are the first words that come to mind. 

Walking in we were immediately greeted, seated and handed hot towels to clean our hands.

Waitress handed us a menu and a daily special menu. My fianc√©e was extremely impressed that the daily menu had the date typed in and was on high quality paper. He said it showed classiness instead of the typical fast hand written specials on a board. 

Fatty tuna ($8) and salmon belly ($7). Best tasting fish I've had in the valley. Have I had good fish else where? Yes, but it was topped with other heavy dressing sauces or ingredients. This was natural, simple and fresh without fishiness. I just can't explain it. 

Next we had the screaming O ($15), which was a fresh salad with tons of ahi tuna. Yum! Very large. I would eat one just as a lunch dish. 

Lastly we had a fatty tuna crunch roll ($15). Best roll I've had without all the crap dragging it down. Loved it! We even ordered a second one and the sushi chef gave us fresh cut jalape√±os and chopped wasabi to try it even spicier. 

Five stars hands down. No AYCE? No problem!! We love AYCE but this beat AYCE by a long shot

To find an authentic Japanese sushi restaurant was a true delight in a city overrun by sushi restaurants. I recommend allowing the Japanese chefs to choose your meal (omakase) and to pair sake for you. We enjoyed an array of delicious fish, urchin, and shellfish. This is by far our favorite new date night restaurant.

Dinner. A welcoming place with great service. It was a bit overwhelming at first due to the size of the menu and having to choose...so I snuck a look at the other yelp reviews. The highly recommended Chirashi was indeed really good, and large! I could do without the imitation crab among all that great fish though. I'm not sure if the chirashi is the same size at dinner and lunch, but it does cost quite a bit more at dinner. The Salmon Teriyaki box was also really good and a big portion, with great salmon quality.  We also had a salmon jaw, which was very good. My wife has to have her fish attached to bones so she had to have it. The Udon looked good, although I didn't try it. The dish that wasn't great was the chicken kara-age. I've had much better, but it was certainly OK.

Would absolutely come again!!
The best and most authentic sushi experince in Las Vegas. Friendly staff and the freshest food. Try the chef's choice sashimi dinner.

My expectations were high. Unfortunately- Sushi Hiro did not deliver on the following:
1) Bento Box- the Teri Beef was tender but the sauce had NO flavor. None. No sweetness. No saltiness. Jus blah. Shumai was cold in the middle and almost pasty. Gross. Portion is big but quantity never rules over quality. 
2) Tempura- no finesse. The tempura was not flaky and delicate. Instead it was globby, oily, and blah. To boot, I think the shrimp tempura was really ebi fry and not tempura. Big difference. 
3) Sushi Rice- could've used a bit more vinegar and tasted more like regular rice. On a couple of the rolls the rice was hard and almost pasted together. Weird sensation and not pleasant. 

Hiro did deliver on the following:
1) Service- excellent. Attentive, friendly, and sincere. Well trained staff. 
2) Ambiance- comfortable. Very clean restaurant. Booths with the curtains is a nice touch. 
3) Flexible- requested a substitution and was accommodated with a smile. 
4) Quality of Fish- on point. Fresh. 

Bottom line- next time we'll go for sashimi and nigiri. I get the feeling they offer the bento to cast a wider net of diners but the attention is on the fish. Not on the bento. I hope they pay more attention to the quality of the sushi rice and maintain the quality of the fish.
Great service , good food , and clean environment! Prices are reasonable for portions. Would definitely recommend!

oh man, don't let the crazy mega strip mall fool u.  This place is excellent and very authentic.  Same goes for the rolls on the menu... there's a boatload to choose from, which a lot of times indicates Americanized, avg level sushi... Nope... not at all.  We had a table, but if u peeked over the chef counter you'd see all sorts of authentic, super fresh stuff.  Clams, Live shrimp... we also got the yellowtail jaw, which was super generous.  The menu, when u dig in, has very legit high quality fish options.   I'd say, go all in on it.  We wish we had ordered more.  

Very good, friendly service.  Priced very generously for the quality of sushi.  And i hate generalizing this, but the sushi chef was straight japanese.  Not Korean, or any other ethnicity.  And how cool was it that he was taking shots of sake w his customers.  Entertainment value of watching this is worth at least 1 star.  

Nonetheless, very high grade sushi at a very, very reasonable price.  Clean restaurant with very friendly service.

I am in a state of bliss.  Fresh, authentic, deliciious, and customer service is fantastic , I have been transported to Japan!  I lived in Japan for four years........this is THE best I have found.  I am in love!!  You will not regret trying Sushi Hiro!!!
Eh! It was just aiight. Glad to have crossed it off my "to-try" list, but I don't think we'll ever be returning. I'm very particular to my Japanese food and the flavors. This was just a Miss for me.
Possibly some of the best otoro I've ever had. Worth twice what they are charging for sure

The service was ok and just because the Sushi comes out in a boat doesn't mean the Sushi is great. I've had better Sushi at other places. Also one of the rolls wasn't meant to be in the mix with the other ones so that was a bit inconvenient. The rolls where loose and fell apart when picked up with chop sticks. 
Towards the end of the night the staff behind the Sushi bar started yelling "vamonos" as in telling us to hurry and pay our bill. I'm pretty sure that falls on a the rude scale. If they did it to us I'm sure they've done it to others. 
Not cool guys, not cool.

Not an ayce joint but totally worth it. Fresh sushi and sashimi,careful prepared and artfully plated. Awesome servers and great selections of rolls and other chef specials. One of the few authentic ones out there.

Ordered to go had the American, Japanese series, David special and rainbow roll.  With the exception of the rainbow roll all were very satisfying and delicious.  The rainbow roll was just average; the fish was not as fresh as I would expect.

Also had the Hamachi carpaccio and was well done with flavors and presentation , even it was packed to go and they still did a great presentation .

I will try having dinner the next time I am in Vegas.

Finally ,if you want the real deal on sushi, you have found it. Amazing atmosphere, clean ,fun . professional, but fresh, tasty, amazing food and sushi. No all you can eat. Thank God. SO that means fresher fish, not frozen of day old stuff. Chef Josh was fun and entertaining. Nun said.

This review would have 5 stars if it were only for the food. We can only give 3 and would even lower it for the several issues and observances at the sushi bar during our meal. Please read to the end.

First, the good: The fish is amazing. Fresh and portions are very generous. The presentation is very pretty. We had kanpachi (amberjack yellowtail) sashimi and sushi, umi masu (ocean trout) sashimi and sushi, uni, salmon and tuna sushi and a rock and roll.

The bad: We sat down at the sushi bar around 5:15 on a Tuesday.  There were only 4 people at the sushi bar and one party in a booth. The 2 waitresses were very disorganized and hurried.  We were not recognized at the bar for a while then our drink orders were taken. After waiting longer the sous chef finally came to take our order. I knew what I wanted but my husband did not so I ordered sashimi kanpachi, uni masu, salmon and tuna.  The sous chef milled around, obviously not making food, and finally the sushi chef asked him what our order was and began making it. It was obvious that he had forgotten because I received only kanpachi and uni masu. At this point a waitress came to take my husband's order. He ordered sushi kanpachi, uni masu, uni and a rock and roll. We were presented with 2 orders (4 pieces of each) of tuna and salmon sushi that we neither ordered that much of or prepared that way. My husband finally got his food after much confusion and miscommunication between the waitresses and chef with near arguments in front of us and a "we'll talk about this later" from the chef to the waitress. We for sure double checked our bill and found we were charged 3 times for one thing that we only ordered 1 of and 3 times for another item we ordered 2 of. 

The worst: Sitting at the sushi bar allows customers to view the chefs making food. It's fun and I enjoy it. This time it was very obvious that extremely dirty towels were being used to wipe the food prep, knives, and hands. At one point, the sous chef was chopping salmon with one of the dirty rags about 3 inches from the fish. He wipes a hand on the towel, continues to chop fish using both hands to mix. A piece of the salmon dropped ON the dirty towel and he picked it up and put it back in the mixture. Sushi Hiro has a unique item on the menu, Wagyu carpaccio.  We did not order it but saw it prepared for others. One order sat on the sushi bar, ready to go out, for about 10 minutes before the waitress finally picked it up. 

This experience is very disheartening.  I guess had I not seen the dirty towels I would not have known but nonetheless, I did see them and the manner in which they are used. It's very hard to find a really good sushi restaurant in Henderson and I wish all the negatives would not have happened because the food was so delicious with generous portions and so fresh and that in itself is hard to find. Can I go back without worrying about contamination?

EDIT 6/1/18: I had reported this to the health department and I looked today to see that a routine inspection happened on 4/23/18, 6 days after my complaint to SNHD.  I see they got their grade lowered to a B and had 20 demerits on routine inspections.
My husband and I went for Dinner and the place was clean and quiet we sat in a. Booth. We had one of their special dinners all very fresh and delicious fish. I would definitely go back,
Great Sushi. Service is great. Petersan and the team are on it. Fish is amazing.  It's one of my new favorite spots.

Decided to try this place out, but bought take out. Portions are large for what you pay for. All sushi items were very fresh even being brought home! The sushi were made very well, and it didn't come apart! Definitely coming back here again, and next time do a sit down try instead of buying taking out! There are bar seating as well of table seating... All staff were very friendly as you enter through the door.

Love this place. The lunch time chirashi lunch is a steal at $16 with something like 14 pieces of sashimi, rice and roe. Very high quality fish, sushi chefs that take pride in the craft and good service. This isn't an all you can eat place. It's for people who really enjoy good quality. But it doesn't break the bank either. This sashimi dinner is amazing!

We decided to try out this new spot on a Friday evening. The place is small yet comfortable. It was about 75% full. 

We were pleasantly greeted upon entering and promptly seated. I had my toddler with me and it was very nice that our server asked me where I would like the high chair placed. Our drink order was taken and our food order was placed. 

I ordered the salmon dinner bento box and my husband ordered 2 sushi rolls. The miso soup and salad that came with my dinner came out immediately.  Unfortunately, the rest of our food took a REALLY long time to come out.  When our server, Grace saw a the look on my face, she came right over to our table to check on us.  She checked on our food and apologized about the delay. When the food finally came out, all was good. My salmon bento box was a great value.  It filled me and my daughter up. My husband said his sushi rolls were just okay- not worth the price we paid.

Grace checked on us several more times and even brought a little toy out to keep my daughter entertained.  

Considering the great customer service that Grace provided us, we may give this place another shot.

I have dined at Sushi Hiro literally 20+ times in the last few years. Only once did I experience anything less than a 5 star experience in both food and service (and that was 3 1/2 - 4 stars). Obviously I'm a happy customer.

This is not a AYCE place but as authentic a Japanese sushi restaurant as you can get in Henderson. In addition to the sushi the bento box dinners have to be mentioned for both quality and the quantity of food ... simply an awesome value.

Great authentic Japanese food!! First time having the nabeyaki udon and it was amazing that we went back we've been back and had it twice in the past week!! My dad got the sashimi platter not knowing what it was and when he got it he was so shocked. It was so much food and different types and was amazing!!!

We finally got around to trying this new restaurant after it had been open for a few months. Great dining experience. The restaurant is small, has table, booth & bar seating. The booths are kind of cool with small curtains giving you a little privacy. Their menu is the typical sushi restaurant items but very user friendly with pictures/descriptions of their rolls, boxed meals, sashimi, including some items made for couples or group meals. The food is very good and rolls are  very well made. The staff and sushi chefs are very friendly and attentive to whatever you need. It's nice to have this restaurant within walking distance and look forward to visiting them again soon.

Located off of Eastern Ave. in the massive shopping plaza with restaurants like Cafe Zupas and Taco y Taco, Sushi Hiro is a welcome addition to the dining scene. Folks in Henderson don't have to drive to the Strip or China Town for excellent Japanese. This modest and modern spot has a long sushi counter. It's the best spot to dine if you want to watch the chefs in action. The omakase (two different options) is reasonably priced at $49 and $69, a bargain for the quality and amount of food you get. 

Halibut sashimi in tofu oil and yuzu began the meal, with an oyster shooter next. A large portion of shrimp and vegetable tempura followed, all lightly coated and exceptionally crispy.

Fish is where they excel. Tuna from Spain, yellowtail, and ocean trout were all sizable cuts of  quality fish. Another large dish followed with the salmon kama deep fried and sitting in a rich and aromatic agedashi broth. The sushi course was also excellent, particularly the tuna and red snapper. All came glazed with house made sauces.

Ending the meal was a rich and dense green tea cheesecake -- creamy like a traditional American style cheesecake instead of a lighter and fluffier Japanese cheesecake.

4.5 Stars

So when it comes to sushi, I'm pretty picky. I tend to stay away from AYCE, well because if you're a true sushi eater, you know AYCE really can't cater to high standards because they can't use top notch fish, and well they have to make money too. So, that's why I went to Sushi Hiro. I went multiple times before writing my review, so at least, I can make a fair judgement call. First, the sushi is great, no doubt about it. And their omokase option is also great. I couldn't give it 5 stars because well, personally, their sushi rice wasn't too flavorful. It tasted a bit more on the bland side. However, with that said, Sushi Hiro is on my regular list of go to places for sushi. I still really enjoyed it, and I still can safely say, I highly recommend this place.

I like their sushi, but it's just inconsistent!  I'll order the crispy roll add smoked salmon on top:

One day I'm getting charged $1, $3, and $6! How do you go from $1 upcharge to $6?  Inconsistency!  Different servers, different chefs... no appropriate button in the system.

The rolls are quite large, unfortunately they don't do half rolls so it just makes it harder to order more than one roll per person.  

The kitchen food is always hot and fresh.  I've had the katsu curry: very flavorful and the katsu was so crispy and moist.  The squid was quite large... it was never-ending.  It was served with a ginger sauce that reminded me of like a soy ginger dressing heated up.

Nice restaurant and booths have a half curtain to make it feel more private. Staff was very nice and friendly. Had the plum tree roll, the best friends roll and crazy tuna roll. All very good. Prices reasonable. Will come again when in the area.

The highest quality fish in town. Meaning the quality is high as Kabuto or yui edomae or yonaka or nobu.
Hiro is the real deal and a true sushi master.
This not a place for mammalukes who like mayonnaise and artificial Krab meat.
If you appreciate quality sashimi and nigiri this is the best place in town.
The prices are very reasonable nearly half the price of other places serving the same quality.

The idiots on here who have given less than 4 or 5 stars look at what they ordered - Philadelphia roll and chicken teriyaki. Morons like that need to stick to sushi mon or other garbage AYCE.

I've been here once before and was happy to find it again. I like the semi-private booths covered by cloth. 
All the sushi we have had here has been fantastic.
Every time you walk in, the staff all greet you with a Japanese hello.
Makes you feel very welcomed.
Enjoy!
First time here. This place looks clean, people are friendly, food is fresh and I like it that they have a special menu for the day with fresh delivery items.

I'm going to have to follow suit and award 5 stars for Hiro his restaurant is simply incredible. I love the atmosphere and friendliness you feel when you walk in. I could go on and on about the delicious food. I used to be a regular at another well known sushi restaurant but Hiro is my new go to favorite. Be sure to check in for a free dessert.

The people here are so nice , the second I walked in they make me feel welcome. The food was AMAZING!!! It is so FRESH... it taste like they just took it out from the ocean. I am a very picky eater ..especially with fish cause some of them r very fishy. But I can tell u this is one of the best place, I will definitely come back again. The chef are so NICE and fast !!! When I was packing my leftover togo he help me packed it up so nicely . He didn't need to do that but he offer to.

OMG!! This place is SOoooooooooooooo AMAZING!   I frequently eat here since they grand opening!  This time I sat at the sushi bar with my sister.  Ordered  baked mussel & sushi special boat.  The mussel was perfectly baked & the sushi boat was outstanding ! The  sushi chef Hiro San & yuki san is so awesome !   They really knew what they were doing!   They seem so professional .          Nice atmosphere , excellent service, & best food & sushi & sashimi   

Actually, I would give them 10 star for the this review!
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!!

The sushi was great. High quality and beautiful presentation. Including the mochi dessert, usually it's just thrown on a plate and given to you. The dessert was very pleasing and attractive. The wine list is short but not a reason to run.

I wanted to love this place, but it was ok. I was really excited about the Omakase, which it's reasonable priced; however I was disappointed about the chef's selections - same fishes for the sashimi and the nigiri dish (the usual suspects: maguro, hamachi, tuna toro, trout - none spectacular). I have eaten sushi at many restaurants, been many times to Japan, so I had never had an omakase where the same fishes are served twice, and in particular almost in the same style (with and without rice). Service was great and the starters were really good, so if I come back I'll order a la carte, which it will be my suggestion to you yelpers.

Best spot in henderson/south Las Vegas area for AUTHENTIC Japanese sushi. Most of the sushi spots in henderson and vegas are Korean owned with mediocre quality/previously frozen fish. However, Sushi Hiro has very fresh high-quality fish that was never frozen. Trust me, you immediately can taste the difference. Once you have FRESH top notch sushi at Sushi Hiro, it's very hard to eat the mediocre sushi at neighboring sushi spots. Everything is so fresh, they even have freshly graded wasabi, which compliments their sushi perfectly. If you want to experience an authentic Japanese sushi experience in Vegas, go to Sushi Hiro! You will not be disappointed.

Awesome find! Very fresh, melt in your mouth sushi. So many amazing, creative rolls. The service was attentive and pleasant. Beautiful Japanese presentation. We were 5 adults with a toddler- accommodated us promptly with our table and a clean, functioning high chair. Will definitely return on our next trip to Las Vegas.

This is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. It's a local spot with local pricing. The fish is as fresh as the top sushi restaurants on the Strip. Sushi Hiro gets fresh fish from Tokyo a couple times a week just like those fancier places. The chirashi is a fantastic mix of fresh fish on a large box of rice. My husband refers to it as the "box of fish." Also try the homemade tofu if it's available. It's a firm type of tofu but the mix of toppings is delightful.

My favorite though, is the chef's tasting menu. Go big! This is an amazing experience. It's 8 courses of delicious raw and cooked foods. Service is great when you're sitting at the sushi bar so I recommend doing that whenever possible. I've never needed a reservation but I usually go on a weekday later in the evening or on a Sunday for lunch.

Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

This sushi house is always with good service, and their food is always delicious! Every time we come it's a wonderful experience and we always enjoy the staff, food and service! I highly recommend this sushi establishment if you want good food and good service.

This place is a hidden gem just off the Las Vegas strip that was recommended to me by my √úber driver. I was a little apprehensive when I pulled up since it is in a strip mall, but after walking in and seeing the gigantic pieces of fresh fish in the open kitchen, my anxiety about dining here subsided. 

Tuna, Salmon, and Yellowtail Nigiri were bar none. The Plum Tree Roll, Crazy Tuna Roll, and Volcano Roll were the perfect combination of spice and fresh fish. Service was great and you could see the chef's putting the rolls together. Awesome experience!

Great find.  We stopped in on a whim and were very pleased. Very clean and well organized. Loved the semi-private booths with the screens. 

The staff was warm and welcoming. Even though this was our first time here the treated us as regulars. 

We look forward to returning

I can't praise this place enough!!!! I refuse to eat sushi anywhere else after going to this restaurant. 

It's located between taco y taco and smash burger and their parking is a bit tiny but it seems like people always come n go. 

The staff is so polite and welcoming as you enter, it's not a big restaurant. It has a L shaped sushi bar, 2 or 3 tables, and a few private booths. I love the decor as well. 

Food...most important part of a review.....best fresh sushi everrrrrrrrr! The quality is just over the top, and the amount they give is so much for such a reasonable price. This place has sushi as well as kitchen prepared foods if you don't like raw food. The menu is limited but I honestly prefer that so they really perfect their selection. If you're one of those who likes rolls, and sauces and deep fried this and that...this is not the place for you. This is real sushi which is just really good rice and fresh fish. They even graid the wasabi right in front of you. No frills no gimmicks, just beautiful traditional Japanese cuisine
I have never had such wonderful service!If you are re-thinking coming here, stop thinking that.The baked salmon is so delicious, my best friends is also delicious.

It's about time they brought a sushi place to this great shopping center of Eastern by Twin Peaks.  Now you can say they have everything here.  

As you walk in, you'll notice the gigantic lantern decor in the ceiling.  The place is bright, clean, and new.  Very welcoming feel.  

I sat at the sushi bar, where Hiro, the Owner of the place, was the sushi chef.  It's always nice to see the Owner working behind the counter.  You can really tell he is really proud of the place, and I agree he should be.  Hiro seems like a hard working, humble, and very personable guy.    

Pretty much all specialty sushi rolls have photos, which is a great idea!  Saves me time on imagining what sushi looks like as I'm reading through the description, when I can just look at the photo and say yep....that's what I want!!  

I decided to try their sushi (nigiri) lunch special.  Comes with miso soup and salad.  

Sushi came with 8 assorted fish of the Chef's choosing, but I requested one of the pieces to be the super white tuna.  Sushi came with pieces of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, red snapper, halibut, shrimb, albacore, and the super white tuna.  Each piece came included some wasabi in between the rice and the fish, which gave some kick to it.  I think more sushi places should include a piece of wasabi in their nigiri sushis.  

If you check in on Yelp, you get free dessert.  I'm glad I tried the green tea tempura ice cream.  They pour bacardi on it in front of you and light it on fire.  Quite the presentation, and the flavor was amaze balls.      

I will be coming back Hiro!

I loved it!  My son and i enjoyed ourselves.  We ordered some sushi (amaebi is always the bomb, some crunchy roll, spicy tuna and calamari) with the chicken katsu bento box and the vegetable tempura.  We were stuffed with leftovers for a late night snack.  Such a convenient spot.  Ill be back!!!

This has to be the best sushi in town! It's my go-to sushi spot every time. The staff and the sushi chefs are so friendly and provide great service. The atmosphere is quaint and appealing. My boyfriend and I always head to the sushi bar and really enjoy the company of the sushi chef/ owner of the restaurant. 
The sushi is very fresh and DELICIOUS! I love the fact that the sushi rolls do not have a thick layer of rice, as that gets a little too much sometimes. My favorite sushi roll has to be the Shrimp Tempura roll, I get it every time. The sashimi dinners are amazing as well, how fresh the fish is and the presentation as well. Whether you're going for a date night or a casual dinner/ lunch, this is an excellent spot for some incredible sushi and friendly staff.

I don't know, but this was just not what I thought it was going to be.
Yes, great service and presentation, but sushi was fresh and totally flavorless.
Toro tuna belly was neutral in flavor, it was like eating plastic. No flavor at all.
Tako Octopus was super chewy and difficult to eat without almost choking and no flavor.
Maybe the items coming in on the airplane from overseas are being stressed from the flight?
The fish on the rolls are tiny tiny tiny, almost a non event to eat the rolls, since they are tiny and flavorless.
There wasn't even one item that had that special something that makes it memorable.
Spider roll had some kind of veggies in it that took away from the soft shell crab and even that ingredient was mushy and flavorless.
What is going on here? Expensive and tastless, I guess some love it here, but it was a total miss in my eyes.
Great decor and service and bland food, the food is what makes me come back and I won't.
Seriously, I was shocked how disappointing it was.

It's hard for me to start a place off with five stars off the bat, but from the service to the quality this place delivered. I actually thought maybe these reviews were a little shady because right off the bat they were getting nothing but praise And 5 stars but this is the real deal

I got the Bento box launch and the sauce on the beef wrapped around scallions was so good I asked to take some home so I can use as a marinade on my steak for tonight

I feel bad is it going to actually have any sushi so I ordered the spicy salmon sushi roll and you can just taste the quality

This place is absolutely amazing! My family and I came here for dinner today and everything we had was beautifully presented. Chef Hiro is talented and extremely good at what he does. Brian and Stella were knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendations. We ordered 1/2 rolls of Fire Dragon, Montauk Beach, Scooby Doo, Mermaid, Davids, World Series; a full roll of Rainbow and a teriyaki chicken bento box. We also ordered 2 orders of gyoza that were deliciously crispy! 
Their desserts are also great! We had mango mochi, red bean mochi, and fried green tea ice cream. 
We enjoyed everything we ordered and I highly recommend this place. We will definitely be back.

It's hard to find not all you can eat sushi restaurant in vegas.
This one is my favorite. Seat on the sushi bar get fresh fish and recommendations from the sushi shef.
Uou will probably spend a bit more than conventional AYCE sushi restaurants but you will enjoy the food much more.

One of my absolute favorite Japanese restaurants in all of Las Vegas, and you don't have to go to the Strip for it!

Sushi Hiro is small but quaint and warm/homey. It is extremely authentic down to the chefs, waitstaff, and oshibori (warm towel service). The waitresses all speak Japanese and some of them are even starting to recognize my family and me due to our frequent visits.

The prices are as expected for a good Japanese restaurant; slightly higher but not exorbitant, and great value considering the extremely high quality of the food.

Service is phenomenal and courteous. The interior is clean and sleek. They take reservations but I can usually get a table without a reservation as well.

I love their main menu, and they have rotating specials as well. They have some sushi too (not AYCE), but I would come here for their more traditional fare. Their chirashi is a very popular item, and they give a lot of food! Overall, the food here is exquisite; I am starting to drool just thinking about it!

Definitely come here for amazing Japanese food; I recommend it to others all the time!

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in all of Las Vegas. Every time I come here, the sushi is FRESH. Great quality and great service every time. The people are nice and friendly. There is a Caucasian female server (sorry I forget her name) who always gives great customer service when we eat there. 

Top quality fish. 
Top quality service.

FYI. If you love udon, their udon is the most delicious out of any other restaurant I've tried!!

Excellent service and food.

All of the tuna's were great - toro tartar, chu toro sushi.

Grilled mushrooms and black cod were really great.  Flavorful and not overpowering.

Apps trio was light and delish.

Even the miso red soup topped it off at the end.

Stumbled on this one and they do serve fresh sashimi! Bento is not a bad choice but a true Japanese style food, they have lots of choices. Good service and price are decent. Will recommend this place to everyone if you're craving for Japanese food.

By far the best sushi joints in the southeast, where quality Asian eateries are few and far between, and easily one of the best in town. 

Sushi (and sashimi) menu is fairly comprehensive, complemented by Daily Catch and Omakase (i.e, A Japanese version of prix fixe). On my first visit, I ordered the Chirashi Lunch Special ($15.95), with a side of Toro and Scallion Roll ($10). The hot tea was free (I think). 

The lunch special came with miso soup, salad, and chirashi bowl. The fish was very fresh and in generous potion, and the sushi rice was very flavorful. I highly recommend it to all who like poke bowls - in comparison to most places specializing in poke bowls, here you are getting high-quality fish of different varieties, proper sushi rice, restaurant-quality soup & salad, and unlimited supply of green tea (that doesn't come from a tea bag). In addition, the lunch potion was so generous that, half way through it, I started to regret the side-dish order. 

The place is clean and bright. Service was friendly and attentive. While I was there, a shipment of 27lbs of tuna came in, and I took a photo of Hiro San going at it - perhaps for the dinner service? In any case, I'll definite be back for the Omakase menu.

I was excited to finally find a sushi restaurant that delivers in the Green Valley area! I ordered directly off of the yelp app. and it went seamless. I would highly recommend to anyone who wants great sushi and quick delivery service!

3.5 star is more like it.

Service - Spectacular
Food - Hubby and I each got the Sashimi dinner and while the pieces are thick and nicely sized, the quality wasn't the best.  The tuna sashimi was my least favorite and the bowl of rice (side order) was not the sushi rice that I was accustomed to.
Dessert - Green Tea Tempura ice cream was what we each selected since we got a free dessert upon check-in via Yelp App offer.  It was beautifully presented, with the waiter lighting the tempura icecream on fire, hence the tempura was nice, warm, and crispy.  I have had green tempura ice cream at many other restaurants, but Sushi Hiro's version is hands down, the best version.

I got a Togo chirashi bowl from here and I have to say I'm pretty disappointed with the selection. From what I saw in the pictures I didn't get as many selection, I think I got some type of raw shrimp and it was so slimy and not tasty omg hard to swallow. The chirashi bowl did come with soup and salad but I would rather pay and extra $4 for Tokyo boys chirashi bowl and no soup and salad. Overall I will not order this again.

Checked our Sushi Hiro and yep, it's not another Las Vegas AYCE restaurant.

The fish & service at Sushi Hiro was fantastic, by far the best I've had in Las Vegas.  I really enjoyed my food and the service was very attentive, chefs very friendly and helpful.

I had given up on sushi, too many places with meh food, but Sushi Hiro brought me back.  I'll be back!!!

Very well done. High quality fish and sushi chefs that know what they're doing. Sit at the counter and talk to the guys. Let them know what you like and they will take care of you. Granted, there may be a small language barrier but it will be worth it.
I came for a late lunch/early dinner. They had a great menu with a lot to choose from. Staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. I'll def be back!
Best sushi in Vegas. My wife and I are sushi snobs, and this is better than most places in LA, and the best we've had in Vegas.

Favorite place for sushi in Henderson. The sushi is fresh and the staff is friendly and welcoming. The sashimi dinner is what I usually get, but this time, I ordered some uni, which basically just melted in my mouth. I've been here twice for dinner on a weekend and have been seated as soon as we arrived.
Awesome restaurant.  Highly recommend the Sushi Boat for parties of 2-3 - more than enough food for all to enjoy.  The mochi was the perfect ending to a great meal.
Looking for amazing sushi and away from all the chaos on the strip, Sushi Hiro is the place to go. Service was quick and sushi was delicious.
I love this place!  Their sushi is amazing!  They also offer brown rice rolls which is amazing!  We order the delivery and they are always really prompt and our order is always accurate.

Cute curtained booths, warm towels, clean restaurant, friendly staff.
Ordered the following:  Karaage, Korokke, Beef Negimaki, Chicken Katsu Curry and Shrimp Tempura Sushi Roll
Loved:  Beef Negimaki, Shrimp Tempura Sushi Roll
Liked:  Chicken Katsu Curry
Pass:  Karaage, Korokke
Total came to $48 + tip. The price was a little high in ratio to satisfaction.  The Karaage were tiny pieces and tasted way overseasoned.  The Korokke was a little disappointing since the picture looked like 4 whole pieces, but when it arrived, it was actually 2 whole pieces cut into halves, so 4 halves...price seems high for 2 whole pieces, 4 would be more pleasing, even 3 more acceptable, but 2!? The Chicken Katsu Curry was plentiful and yummy and the shrimp tempura sushi roll was exactly as expected. The winner of the evening was the Beef Negimaki - I could eat this dish alone, just give me a bowl of rice to go with it and I'd be a happy camper.
Great place to go for Japanese food if you are in the Henderson area.

Went to have dinner.... I was pleased to see how beautiful the restaurant is!! I just loved it!! Felt like I was in LA at the Grove.  The service was outstanding... Entire staff made you feel like part of their family. Then the best part was our dinner.. Fresh and delicious . We can't wait to go back for more.

I've only been here once, and I usually visit restaurants at least a couple times before giving them the big 5* - but I'm pretty certain Sushi Hiro will hold up. The reason is that the fish quality is very high, the availability of traditional Japanese fish is good (e.g. on my visit, mirugai, kinmedai, and yari ika were all on the specials list), and it seems like Chef Hiro knows what he's doing.

I see this place as somewhere I see myself splurging a ton ordering a la carte just because the quality is so high, which is great b/c there's nowhere I feel compelled to do that on this side of town. Really the only other places in Vegas I do that right now are the two edomae spots in Chinatown, which are only open for dinner and usually need reservations. Hiro offers a more casual, anytime option, and that's great for people on the Henderson side of things.

I look forward to repeat visits, including trying some of the hot food as well as the omakase menu, and updating my review accordingly.

We recently moved here from Los Angeles and have been desperately searching for our sushi place and we finally found it!! From the moment you walk in you feel like you're with friends!  The wait staff and chefs are all super friendly and helpful and the food is....OUT OF THIS WORLD!  The quality of the fish and the attention to detail is what sets this place apart from anywhere we've ever been!! We can't wait to make this place our default date night location!
Sushi was great first time here! They did a great job making Leslie a "special roll" she had a great time! Staff was friendly.

Came here with high expectations and was severely disappointed. While the people were extremely friendly and the restaurant was clean and had a great atmosphere, the food was sorely lacking in taste and quality. The rice in particular was terrible; not sure if it was a lack of water or over-cooking. The sushi was off as well, with the tuna being somewhat dry as if it had been out for a while, while the eel tasted overcooked. The avocado was not quite ripe; it affected the taste and texture. Definitely not going back.

I am definitely not a big fan of this place. I have came here multiple times hoping that it would get better and it never does. Their sashimi is not something I would ever recommend getting here. The most recent trip here the tuna looked to be very old; it was discolored with a greenish tint and a bit fishier than normal. They are also a bit overpriced for the quality of food that they have. The food not pertaining to fish was decent though. Lunch time would be the best time to go.

I'm sitting here 8 hours later with how soft, fatty, and delicious the salmon sashimi was, along with all the other rolls I had the pleasure of trying today. First time, located on eastern and 215, in the same complex as BJs and taco y taco. It's a small place and it was very clean. The service was excellent! Rolls came out fast. Fish is top quality, everything was so great! No AYCE. Came for lunch and it was not busy at all. Compared to other sushi restaurants in the same area, this one is worth the stop!

Just tried out this newly opened sushi resturant and I'm so impressed.  The best Charashi in Henderson /Vegas and I've tried it at every sushi resturant in the area. It's assorted  sashimi over sushi rice.  Fish was very fresh and the sushi rice was amazing.  The restaurant is very clean and friendly.  I will definitely come back and I highly recommend it.

I was going to hit up the taco y taco next door, looked crowded so we hit up Sushi Hiro... serendipity af..and I'm glad it happened!

Hiro Service:  I've been here multiple times since the first visit and the service is comparable to a $$$$ restaurant.  Once seated, you are presented with a warm hot towel to freshen up.   Everyone is friendly and although a small restaurant, it's not uncommon for multiple servers to check on you throughout your dining experience. Fantastic

Hiro Sushi & more:  This is not an AYCE sushi joint but they offer numerous in house rolls (currently 40 on the menu)  All the nigiri, sashimi and rolls I've had have been very tasty and fresh. My current favorite roll there is the "out of control" (#9)  Loaded with eel, crabmeat, cream cheese & avocado inside along with suna, salmon, & yellowtail outside.
