It's like an inverted philly roll with all kiiinds of #gainz.  The Bento boxes are packed with so much food that it's hard for me to finish.  The Udon is at a level better than some stand alone Udon restaurants in the Vegas Valley.  I'm just as impressed with their non-sushi dishes, excellent.

Hiro Ambiance:  Modern Sushi house decor with dark wood being used throughout the restaurants for tables, chairs, and booths.  The Sushi bar is shaped like an L and seats about 15 people?  You can dress casually or dressy and both would be fine at Sushi Hiro.

The great service that hasn't faltered coupled with the high quality food makes for great visits which is why I frequent here weekly.  The omakase experience is coming up soon but that's another Yelp tale.   Arigato! =)

Amazing sushi.   We normally go to I love sushi.  However this place was much cleaner newer and everything was delicious. Great service as well! We have the yellowtail with jalape√±os and the dragon fire.  Saki was really good too. Comes in an ice bucket to keep it chilled. And the coolest thing is everyone yells when you leave. Makes you feel special. Thanks for an amazing evening and dinner!!

As a sushi lover in Las Vegas, I've found it easy to fall into the mindset that I either have to aim edomae style sushi for super-expensive high-end fish or AYCE sushi for more modest quality but high variety and cost efficiency. However, places like this prove that you can find a great compromise.

Sushi Hiro is one of the newer spots in this middle-of-the-road sushi segment. They do have omakase options, but their dinner menu has more easily afforded options. Sandwiched between a taqueria and a fast casual burger chain location in a popular and convenient plaza on Eastern near Richmar, this place has been on my radar for a while now, but I only managed to visit it when some friends came up with it as a backup plan after we learned that our first choice for Friday night dinner was shockingly busy.

I entered to find my group already seated at a booth rather than the bar, and they seemed to be going toward the less pricey end of the spectrum, so there was no way I was going for omakase regardless. I ended up choosing the Sushi Dinner ($29.95), which consists of the typical sides of salad and miso soup, a small tuna roll, and the chef's choice of ten pieces of nigiri.

For what it's worth, the salad had an atypical, not so sweet dressing and was fresh, and the miso soup was balanced. I'll also say now that the tuna was pretty tasty in its simple presentation, which is at the center of one of those thin tubes fully wrapped in nori. No fancy sauces or fish on top here, just a few simple and well-executed ingredients. These pieces ended up being a nice palate cleanser following certain subsequent bites.

Most deserving attention was the nigiri course. Ten different fish (well, nine actual fish and one shrimp) were represented here, and some had garnishes while others were presented unadorned, with a small wasabi layer gluing these pieces to the rice underneath. Also, after I looked back at the menu to compare pricing for individual orders of nigiri, I determined that the monetary value easily swings toward choosing this sushi dinner, and to have the benefit of variety on top was music to my taste buds. You're welcome for the mixed metaphor.

Lest I ramble on too much about the fish, they all had excellent flavor variations and will taste familiar if you've eaten them elsewhere. The ones on my plate were maguro (tuna), hamachi (yellowtail), sake (salmon), aji (horse mackerel), ebi (shrimp), super white tuna, ma dai (a Japanese snapper, also called sea bream), red snapper, albacore, and saba (mackerel). The mackerel types clearly had more fishiness, certain fish were mushy but in an obviously deliberate way (salmon, sea bream), and the ebi never tastes special to me, but everything was distinct and enjoyable in its own way. Oh, and the size of each piece is what I'd call a moderate mouthful. Don't you dare bite it in half though...

I also tasted a couple of other items on our table. There was a roll with tuna inside, eel on top, and eel sauce all over (named eel lover's roll, perhaps, and going for around $13) which was quite enjoyable as far as rolls go. The Curry Rice ($11.95) was a massive portion of this common Japanese dish, and the depth of flavors plus the delicious Tonkatsu (breaded pork) will almost certainly be my order on a future visit. As a Henderson resident, this steal of a deal might preclude most if not all future trips to Spring Mountain or the Southwest for similar dishes. Lastly, two tablemates had bento boxes, and while I didn't sample anything of these dishes, the portion size looks more than appropriate for dinner.

Sushi Hiro is a very respectable sushi joint with a few other Japanese dishes up their sleeve, and I'm already feeling the urge to return for a small taste of more of their pricier fish as well as such simpler options as described above. They're worth a visit for sushi enthusiasts of all levels as well as the fish-averse.

My third time coming here this month. Professional chefs. Everything about this place is authentic Japanese except all of the waitresses. Good food. The sushi is very good quality. Good wait staff. I have yet to be disappointed. Definitely try this place out.

Came here during the week for a late lunch. Sat at a booth instead of the sushi bar since Iz my pug tagged along. The menu is large and has a variety of choices from bento boxes, sashimi, rolls, sushi, curry and ramen. 

We ended up going with omakase for two. The service and quality were outstanding and the price was fair. I ended up dining for several hours since there was so much food and had great conversation with the owners wife. Chef Hiro is not new to this industry - he's been in the business for over twenty five years and had a restaurant on the east coast and in little Tokyo in Los Angeles that's still operating.

I wish the best for the Hiro's new Japanese restaurant and would definitely recommend them for authentic quality Japanese food.

Place was superb. I had the chicken terriaki bento box. Ate the whole thing plus two things of sake and sushi. The employee are very humble and nice. They greet you when you walk in and all say bye to you on your way out. They start the meal with a hot warm towel to wash your hands with. Nice privacy tables. Loved it

The two chefs are so frendly and nice!  We went there at the lunch time and ate Sashimi lunch.  The raw fish was fresh and very tasty.  I'm glad we have a REAL JAPANESE Sushi restaurant in Henderson area. The atmosphere inside is authentic Japanese, it reminds me of back home in Japan. Strongly recommend if you want to eat true sushi.
Delicious sushi! Always tastes so fresh to me. Huge rolls too, so if you order half rolls it's so cost friendly and you get to try so many! Chefs really care about plating, too. Love this place!

We were looking for the authentic Japanese sushi restaurant outside of Vegas Strip on our way back from Moab, Utah and I found the Sushi Hiro.  Wow!!!  Delicious sashimi...We ordered whole Japanese Spanish Mackarel sashimi and 1/2 of the Red Snapper sashimi that so delicious just like we revisited Japan.  It's fresh and melted in your mouth!!!  It's hard to find any place that can make a whole fish out of the sashimi except Sushi Hiro.  We can't find this place in Washington D.C...you can't beat the price because it's really cheap compared to Morimoto in MGM Vegas strip and the taste much better believe me!  We requested to have the fish bone deep fried and grill for $20 extra and it's worth it because our kids love it...The lady server is really nice and fast service since we were an early bird for dinner and hardly anyone there so we got the best service in house for that day...:-)  Next time if we ever come back to Vegas, we're definitely will be here again for sure.... My sister and her husband come to Vegas twice a year for a furniture show so they definitely will come back here with friends and family soon...Thank you Chef!  Our family will support your restaurant all the way...:-)

Authentic. Quality. Tasty.

Three words that came to mind after every dish eaten here. The ambience in Sushi Hiro is lowly lit and quiet. The focus and spotlight is on the sushi chefs and it is enjoyable to observe them. 

Upon entering and exiting, the entire staff greets every guest with a shouted welcoming in Japanese and/or English. From the second you walk in, it feels like home here and there is a relaxed environment. There isn't anything I don't recommend here but the dishes that stood out were the toro and crispy rice special, spicy scallop, and the takoyaki. The toro belly melts in your mouth and it is complemented by the crispy rice patty it sits upon. The spicy scallop is remarkably fresh and the takoyaki is decadent. The chefs here REALLY know how to cut and select fish. The service is impeccable and fast! They make you feel like they are serving you in their home. A definite return visit is in the near future!!

We don't have a lot of time to go out to eat, so for our anniversary we ordered a bunch of sushi to be delivered. It was delivered on time by a man in chef gear. We ordered a lot and it was expensive, but this has to be the best sushi in the neighborhood. The ingredients are better so it tastes better. The next morning my wife had the leftovers for breakfast and it was still in good condition. It was worth the money. Don't think I can imagine eating anyone else's sushi anymore.

IRASSHAIMASE without an accent?! Okay, already feeling a 5/5 star restaurant here.... 
Let's get straight to the point, Sushi Hiro has Japanese sushi chefs behind the counter and even Japanese waitresses. The sushi chefs are a pair of brothers that own a sushi shop in the main plaza of Little Tokyo in LA. After talking to them, they promised me that they serve the freshest quality of fish in LV :) 
They don't have AYCE and their a la carte nigiri prices are pretty pricey, so I suggest ordering off their lunch specials menu. They have a dinner specials menu, but it is the same as the lunch menu, but more expensive (by about $3-5). 
We ordered the obento boxes (chicken katsu, salmon). The chicken katsu was pretty bad, extremely rubbery and I wouldn't order it again (3/5 stars based on just that). The salmon was a lot better. The portion size is huge, you get a choice between tempura and california roll, with gyoza, egg roll, salad, miso soup. If you're new to Japanese food, I suggest starting here. However, it was more for the portion than the taste. 
Where they really shine is their chirashi and sushi plate. The sushi plate was very filling and the quality of fish was pretty good. Ask what they're including on the sushi plate before you order! Even better, sit at the sushi counter and make friends with the chefs, get the real Japanese experience! The chirashi is HUGE. SO filling and SO much fish. I'm amazed by the portion size and the quality every time I go (Yeah, I've been here a lot) 
??????????????????????????????????????

We had the baked muscles, rock n roll, supersonic and the baked salmon roll. They were all really good. The rock n roll and baked salmon roll are in hot oil and I don't like spicy but it didn't bother me. And I'm just checking in for the dessert! lol

I came here when it first opened and the service was kinda slow and unorganized but I didn't think it was fair to rate them on that since they were new. 

I came back today for a second time and the service was much improved. I'll admit, I'm a sushi snob. I was not particularly impressed with the rolls or the menu items, but they do have hands-down the best chirashi I've had in Vegas. 

I suggest that if you are also a sushi snob that you come here for the chirashi or nigiri items. The fish always seems to be fresh and the cuts are generous.

Sushi here was so fresh and delicious and the price wasn't crazy expensive for the quality of it. Fish just melts in your mouth. Place was clean and I love the design inside. I love the booth because they have the black cover when you sit in the booth. Our servers were very nice and attentive. I ordered the chirashi for lunch and my friend ordered sushi lunch. Both very delicious!!!!! I love this place definitely recommend and will come back. I checked here in Yelp and had a surprise for free dessert. Of course I got the tempura fried ice cream and it was on fire which was cool. I took care of my server and tip them well for a fabulous job. Definitely will come back

I had been hearing about how great sushi Hiro was since it opened, but just finally made it in.   Walking inside you pass through the split red curtain into an almost nautical design.  They have bar seating, table seating in the middle,  and more secluded booth seating to the side.   They also have like 4 menus, but if you have an idea of what you want you can navigate fairly quickly.   They also hand you a warm towel to clean your hands before the meal. 

What many people continued to reference was how fresh the fish was here, and honestly they did not disappoint.   I really enjoyed watching the sushi chefs, and the  care they put into handling their product.   The rolls themselves are very generous portions, and we'll worth their price.  No all you can eat here, this place is about the quality not how much you can shove in your face.   I actually converted one of my friends who always insists on all you can eat,  through a meal here.    One item she cannot stop talking about is the higher level cut of the tuna nigiri she got.  They had been out of their cheaper option, so she went for the 10 dollar one.  It was the size of like 5 all you can eat portions,  thick almost like a steak,  and buttery.  

Now some rolls that stood out to me through both visits were the best friends roll,  and the rock n roll.  Their sashimi at lunch is such a great deal for how amazing the cuts are.   They put a chilli sauce on one of my white fish cuts though that was not my favorite.  Also the miso soup they have is fairly basic,  and the dressing on the salad although very fresh tasting is a little heavy in onion.   Also even though overall the service is stellar,  I would have liked them to tell me what fish selection the chef gave me.  I had an idea,  but it's nice to know for the future when I order. 

 I also love that they have some more obscure options on the menu for the foodies like egg custard,  it had the perfect jiggle to it,  with the broth from the meats inside breaking through with each spoonful.  It was savory yet light,  and oh so comforting. 

One little tid bit that really made me happy, is in addition to grated wasabi, you can order chopped wasabi. They also let you order their other sauces on the side as well.  

For dessert I have a deep weakness for fried ice cream,  especially green tea flavor.  So when I saw they had this, I had to have it.   They even light it on fire to add to the crunch right in front of you.   The green tea itself is lighter in flavor not a heavier matcha, but it was still lovely with all the components.  They top it with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. 

I had to give this place 5 stars because a week later I was already back,  and I look forward to many more visits exploring their menus.

We ordered the Bamboo Omakase from the Chef's table. Now, understand I'm not a bigger sushi eater. I don't like to eat sushi because I'm scared it'll make me sick which usually it does. But after reading a few peoples review I wanted to try this place for their freshness. I was going to order the Pine Omakase but was scared it'll be too much food for both of us. Boy was that a mistake! I was still hungry after our Bamboo Omakase so I had to order a Philly roll. LOL. People are right, the raw fish here is good. And it's fresh. The sushi chef infeont of us cut a live shrimp and made it into sashimi for the table next to us. It was crazy! Even if you don't order the Omakase, order the Black Cod. OMGSH! Just do it, and you'll understand. The only reason why I have them a 4 star was because I thought the food was going to keep coming. But instead we were sitting there 7-10 minutes in between each dish. The whole dinner probably took about 2 hours.

I loved this place right away and just knew it was a five star sushi spot. 

As soon as we walked in we were warmly greeted. The hostess offered sushi bar seating or a booth. We opted for a booth which has nice shades on each side for some privacy. Our hostess ended up being our waitress and she started us off with warm towels. The first thing that struck my attention was how clean the restaurant appeared. 

I started with the House Salad and the cold ginger dressing didn't disappoint. My husband and I shared the Shumai appetizer which was tender and delicious. We weren't overly hungry so we stuck to sharing two rolls, the Funky Roll and the Fire Dragon Roll. Both tasted fresh and had great flavor. The rolls were nice portions. I wrapped up with the Yelp check-in offer for a free dessert. The Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream was so delicious. I loved the crisp of the tempura coating and the creamy green tea ice cream.

Our waitress provided amazing service during our visit. She was friendly and attentive. Our food came out quickly. Overall, we were delighted with our experience here. This is one of those restaurants that I wish I could give six stars.

People have been telling me how great this place is so I finally decided to try it and it was! It's a bit more upscale and pricier for an off the strip sushi spot, but has on the strip quality. Their nigiri portions are massive and are paired with their special fermented/aged soy sauce. They have some unique items that basic sushi places don't carry such as fish belly and collar which I both highly recommend. I got the chu toro and yellowtail belly which both melt in your mouth. Staff is very friendly and walked me through the menu as I had never been there. Will be coming back!

What an amazing place! If you want a basic, quick and not fancy sushi, go to the dozen all you can eat places. If you want high grade and the best a true Japanese place can offer - Sushi Hiro is your place to go.

I love the atmosphere and the friendly chefs that are always eager to give you alternative choices. My favorites here are the shishito peppers and the super white sushi. The yellow taiI with jalepe√±os is awesome too. I always have items from the daily menu and everything is always super fresh.

I highly recommend this true sushi treasure.

Really nice staff. Really mushy sushi rice. Worst tempura...ever. Something you might find at Denny's (the shrimp), nothing at all like light Japanese tempura. 

I don't understand all the high reviews. Maybe they were having an off day.
Amazing food and staff is very friendly and helpful. Definitely going back to sushi Hiro.
Love the Pine Omakase here! Hiro & Yuki are very talented chefs! Their craftsmanship on the art of sushi is phenomenal!

Sushi Hiro is exactly what Las Vegas is missing. Just good, honest, high quality sushi. We ordered the $65 omakase and it was perfect! So much food I could not finish it all. We had sashimi to start, then nigiri, 1 cooked fish and then more sashimi. Not only was the quality fresh but we were lucky enough to sit in front of Chef Hiro son. Needless to say he was one of the nicest Sushi Chefs I've ever had. 5 stars is easy!
Ordered lunch bento box to go and it was so good! The taste and portion size were both excellent. I'll definitely come back to try other menu items.

Among the sea of trendy, hip, all-you-can-eat sushi restaurants, there is a jewel of a sushi establishment that sticks to a more traditional flair with quality ingredients, friendly staff, and a homey atmosphere. 

This place reminds me of a lot of sushi places of the late 90s, early 2000s. You know, those small mom & pop shops, but with a tasteful updated decor and aesthetic style. It just feels welcoming.

As soon as you're seated, you're greeted with a warm moist towel. A rare sight to see these days at any restaurant. They're refreshing, clean, comforting, and very Japanese. I could already tell that this was going to be a good dining experience at that point.

I came here for good sushi, and that is all I ordered. The salmon and yellowtail nigiri were great. Smooth, buttery, and tasted so fresh. However, the chutoro nigiri was just so, so good. It was worth the $14 for those pieces. The rest of my orders were a salmon roll, negihama roll, and negitoro roll. All again very good, but the negitoro roll tasted amazing. Almost divine. It's just something about that combination of the fish and scallions that add an extra dimension of flavor that is almost mindblowing. I'm a guy who enjoys minimal ingredients at the tastiest levels, so this was a near perfect meal. 

The presentation of the dishes are also noteworthy. The nigiri pieces were beautifully and precisely cut, served on a curved stone plate, and the rolls neatly placed, also on a unique stone plate.

If you want to take a break from the AYCE scene, or you're ready to take the next step into a more authentic Japanese dining experience, then Sushi Hiro is the place to go.

We came here to check it out, the place wasn't busy at all. HOWEVER it took about 45 minutes to get our food. I'm not exactly sure if the food was delicious, or if I was just starving by the time we were served. Either way, we  won't be returning
Excellent! Price is reasonable for top grade fish. Omakase was terrific, especially for the price...salmon belly in the soup was winners!

Being here the third time always when I'm in Las Vegas. 
So far everything was outstanding. Had a chat with the boss last time and they are from Japan, really! 
Agedashi tofu today was the best I ever had. Rolls were tasty and fresh. Great!!

What a lovely find! My new favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas! This place is a drive from the strip and doesn't have that chic ambience. However, they serve high quality, authentic style sushi without the jacked up prices that you would find on the strip.

We opted not to do the omakase as we were looking to get sashimi only and didn't care for the extra appetizers, sides, and cooked fish. We ordered the chirashi and sashimi dinner platter. Beautiful presentation and very fresh fish. I really liked how the chirashi had a generous amount of tobiko in the rice. I also really liked the two different types of tomago in the chirashi. I'm not one to comment on the tomago, but both tasted delicious! One of them had this cake-like taste to it. I'd definitely get it again.

We sat by the bar and saw the sushi chefs in action. All the dishes they were preparing looked great and while we wanted to order more, we were pretty stuffed by the end of our meals.

Great service as well!

Very disappointed went here on my lunch break due to the reviews on yelp. This place was way over priced and I have eaten sushi many diffrent places. Price is not a issue when it come to great service and food. So when I got back to my work place to eat my 5 pieces of sushi my eel had bones in it not one bone and not two there were tons in every piece  to the point it just was more work to eat then enjoy.. I eat eel ever time I eat sushi and NEVER have had bones in it.. when I called the chef and he said it was normal that all eel does well now I know they serve bones in eel here.. I will go to another location I love up the street that does not serve bones in my rolls. I ordered seaweed salad,eel sushi and a soda for 24.00 craaazy.

When it comes to al a cart sushi most people expect good quality fish and real traditional environment, and that's what this place offers. Hands down the best sushi restaurant I have been to. The 2 head sushi chefs are two brothers from Japan and everything they serve they put their own pride into. The fish were super fresh and big portions of fish. Everything was smooth and buttery. I'm really picky when it comes to sushi and this place is the only place in Vegas I would trust. Even more than the sushi restaurants on the strip. I wish I could give this place 10 stars I would. Hiro is an amazing sushi chef with lots of knowledge and personality. MUST TRY!!!
The food here is bomb! I love the appetizers, and they have a huge selection to choose from. Service is alright, but other than that it's a good little sushi spot.
Fresh sushi in town! Our new favorite sushi place. Will be back soon. Highly recommended!
First experience having sushi at LV. Amazing!!! Food and service are very good. Highly recommended!!!

My cousin used to work here and recommended that my sister and I go here and tbh this sushi spot is super good! If you were to eat in,sit at the booth. The booth is pretty and its like your own private area kinda(they cover the booth with curtains). When you sit, they give you a warm hot towl for your hands and they give you the menu. They have a lot to chose from but i'll always get the rolls. The sushi plate my sister ordered was good! You can taste the freshness of the seafood. The only thing about the sushi, they put wasabi on the seafood and the rice so that it wont fall apart so heads up to those who don't like//want wasabi on their sushi. Theyre Japan Series Roll is amazing!! In the chicken teriyaki beno box they give alot because it also comes with house salad and miso so you'll get pretty full. Tip: ALWAYS order a side of eel sauce whem you order any of the rolls that have eel in it. Itll taste so much better. What I do like about this place is that all theyre seafood is fresh so you can actually taste it. The only thing, when my sister got the Fatty Tuna sushi from the fresh seafood sushi menu it has that oil after taste and when you bite into the middle, theres something in there thats spicy and its not wasabi thats the only thing. Overall, I love this place. It's pretty far from the strip, its more in the subburbs area so expect a pretty far drive like around 10-15min drive i think.
$65 omakase is the way to go. Literally blown away by the quality and amount of sushi Chef Hiro serves at that price. Highly recommend if you're craving sushi in the Las Vegas area!

Very pleasantly surprised.  Read the reviews and have to agree.  Sushi Hiro has excellent food and service at a solid value.  We had the Bamboo omakase (mid tier @ $69) and had a great meal with very good cuts of fish.  The cooked food was as good as the sashimi and sushi.  Our table also ordered a roll - one of the largest rolls I have seen.  Usually that means lesser quality, but that was not the case here.  Give Sushi Hiro a try!

Alles perfekt!!!
Tolle Bedienung, frischen und feinen Speisen!
Auf alle F√§lle empfehlenswert!!

The sushi was good and seemed fresh. We ordered delivery. We ordered baked lasagna, which is one of our favorites at another local sushi bar and the cheese were just blocks sitting on top, it wasn't saucy like others I've had. So we may try it again, but at the restaurant next time.
First time here. This place is great. Come try it out. Food is awsome and so fresh. They gave you warm towels to clean your hands with. So great.

This is my go to sushi place in Henderson. Fish is fresh and I always walk out soooo full. It ain't cheap though, so be prepared to spend about $100 if you love sushi. Definitely get the toro and scallion roll, toro tartare on crispy rice (it's not actually tartare..there's nicely chopped pieces of toro), uni, yellowtail belly, salmon belly, shishito peppers, and yellowtail collar. If you're really hungry, their rolls will fill you up. One order has like 20 pieces it seems. Salmon lover is my go to roll when I'm super hungry but don't want to spend too much $$. The servers and chefs are attentive too. I sat at a table against the back wall and the chef noticed I liked ginger so he had a server give me a whole bowl of it. Coming from OC, I miss having fresh sushi, but this place really fills that void.
Good food, Good service will come back next time when I am in LV!!!
Fresh fish.  Melts in your mouth.  Good prices especially for lunch

Excellent service, spirit and ambiance! The food rocked--generous portions as well. I also appreciate that it is open a bit later than other sushi restaurants in the area. We will definitely be returning very soon.

I enjoyed Sushi Hiro very much. There is such a plethora of Sushi places in town and that is such a great thing for us Las Vegans.  There are very traditional places, the popular Roll type of sushi houses and in this case with Sushi Hiro, a blend of your Roll type sushi house meets tradition.

1. The authenticity - I really love it when you can walk into a Sushi Restaurant and the Japanese that is spoken is more than just Irrashaimasu.  To hear the sushi chefs speaking the lingo and calling out orders for pick up in that traditional way just adds to the ambiance.

2.  The ambiance - I like the simple originality of the place. Big Sushi bar, a few tables in the middle, and then booths with a bit of privacy along the side.  Clean, efficient lighting and those large wrapped Sake Barrels used as part of the decor.  Lighting is just right, the lights themselves are so simple and nice.  Just a great place to enter.  Not much room for waiting though.

3. Service - The team tonight was tapped out as it was freaking busy at 8:00 pm on a Friday night.  The wifey and I entered when there was a small lull, but about 8:45 pm the second or third wave hit and it was swamped. But alas, the team is so friendly, nice and welcoming.

4.  The Food - That is what we are here to talk about so let's rock this place out.

a. The rolls - As you may be aware by now, I am not a huge roll fan, however, I find them definitely edible and tasty. I mean, as a comparison,  I find grilled cheese and PBJ sandwiches tasty and edible, just don't order it much.  Back to Sushi, the rolls here are very good. Rather than the huge massive rolls that are packed and heavy, these rolls are rather delicate. each piece is cut thin and each piece is about 75% the size of those normal rolls you get elsewhere. I do like this in many ways because the taste is simpler, more defined and it seems the nature of the fish and rice stands out more.  When I go to an AYCE Sushi place, I can eat the rolls, but i find that all the flavors and the tastes are masked due to all the sauces and ingredients mixed in.  Here the essence of the sushi is more refined.  If you are a big roll eater and like that huge mix of ingredients, you will find perhaps some disappointment, so be aware that this is entirely a different style of sushi rolls.

b. The Goodies - 

Ankimo - ordered up an order of Ankimo, monkfish liver.  You don't get to find this everywhere. It was great and with a bit of scallion, daikon and ponzu sauce to round it out. I am not sure why I like monkfish.  Don't google a picture of one.  I don't know who goes around the world saying "look at that fish"  isn't that one tasty fellow!  When I got my first look at a monkfish, I think it was a bit frightening.

Mirugai - You cannot imagine how many sushi places I go to and attempt to get this Geoduck clam or any other type of clam and it is not easy to get. I get a no more than a yes. Here they had it as a special and i ordered it sashimi style. Again, simple, great texture, fresh.  One of my favorites and they had it.  Loved that they served it very simply in a plate with some Wakame.  A nice pairing.  By the way, if you ever googled a picture of this clam, you would probably never order it, so don't google it...and keep your kids away from it.

O-Toro- When ever I am ordering sashimi and tuna specifically, I generally am getting the Maguro. Love Maguro and you get a lot of it in an order as well.  Here they had as a special O-toro. That fatty belly part of the tuna is so tasty and melts in your mouth. I often don't get it at many places, but ask and here it was one of the specials. I enjoyed it and that made it a bit special tonight.

Escolar Super White Tuna - Whenever I go to a place and they have superwhite, I have no idea if it is albacore tuna or escolar fish.  Here they tell you straight up it is escolar.  That fatty special controversial fish that many consider a delicacy.  I guess some people's stomach does not go well with the fatty content that makes this fish so nice.  I had it as a sashimi as well at enjoyed it.  I won't order this all the time, but I do like to order it when I am feeling a wee bit adventurous.

Scooby Doo Roll and the Fashion Roll - Hey, come on, you knew I was going to get a roll anyway!  I had a few bites of these rolls and like I said above, nice, simple, delicate.

Dessert - If you check in on yelp, right now they are offering a free dessert. Mochi ice cream and it tastes great. Always like that.

I will be coming back here for sure to try more of what they offer.  I stuck mainly to the specials and sashimi tonight to get the best possible taste of their fish offerings.  For the second time here, I enjoyed it and will be coming back for sure!

I would've given this place 4 stars, but apparently when I went to pick up the order, they had already given it to someone else. I don't really know how that happens. Aren't you supposed to ask the name on the order and then confirm what they ordered before just handing the food over? So I had to wait for them to remake everything that I had ordered 30 minutes before. The sushi was good and fresh, but nothing outstanding or memorable. I had high hopes for this places because of all of the reviews. But maybe they're better to dine in instead of take out. I also recommend when people order take out sushi that they should label the boxes with the names of the rolls instead of it being a guessing game.

Food was horrible chicken was clearly frozen or old everything deep fried was nasty , soft shell crab was not fresh and the ice cream didn't have whip cream or anything waste of 37$ idk how u have 5 star reviews or did I call for delivery on a bad day ?

I love this place. After eating here, I don't think I could eat at the AYCE places anymore. Quality surpasses quantity here. I left feeling good and not grossly stuffed.

I had the sashimi lunch and the fish selection was delicious and fresh. I love uni and had to order two orders of them. It was so fresh and sweet. From the specials menu we ordered the o-toro (bluefin fatty tuna belly) and the mirugai (geoduck). The bluefin was melt in your mouth delicious. The geoduck had a nice crunchy, chewy taste. It was something different. The only critique I could make was that the fish was cut so large. It was a two biter. I rather have it cut into smaller pieces so it's not overwhelming. This place is not cheap so of course they want to give you your money's worth, but cut it smaller and have more pieces than? I love this place and will be back.

We tried to stop in on a Monday and they were closed! FYI

Sushi Hiro has become our favorite restaurant and it is in our regular rotation for date night. This place works out for everyone because it has all the rolls you can imagine, but we don't come here for that.  (But if that's your thing, you'll be more than happy here!)  

Our focus is the sashimi dinner, the dinner chirashi, and whatever daily fish they have in stock.  With fresh deliveries coming in twice a week, I love looking out for their most unique items and our favorite is getting the whole Aji Tsukuri.  They recently had this Uni Tray that came with toro, salmon eggs, seaweed, and rice and you put the whole thing together yourself.  So good!  I am happy to bypass all the AYCE sushi joints in town to get some quality fish here.

I really can't say enough about Chef Hiro and his team. I love coming here and they know it. They've been open for a little over a year now and are going strong.  It's super busy on weekends, so make reservations! Families are welcome and large parties are often present.  If you see me there, don't be shy to say hi!

Great new sushi place. Their staff is amazing and the service is great. The Scooby Doo roll and mermaid roll were very delicious. There's also a lot of variation and choices. I'll definitely be returning to try the other rolls.

I am so happy they are in my neighborhood! Great quality ingredients!
We shered tradirional course dinner "Pine Omakase" with Wagyu Ishiyaki (sliced beef cooked over hot stone). Loved cource dinner Every single item were superb!  Friendly owner & atmosphere.I don't think I would go back to AYCE sushi.

Wow, HUGE disappointment!
 Placed an on-line take-out order yesterday evening  via Eat24 app, to be picked-up about 40 min later at 9PM.

I ordered Curry Rice with Tofu ($11.95) & Teriyaki Don, also with Tofo ($11.95).  Picked-up my order at 9:02PM, and the first thing I noticed was that the take-out bag didn't seem to be as hot as it should be -- I suspect they made my order closer to 8:20PM when I placed it, versus waiting a while, knowing that I specified a 9PM pick-up time.   During my brief encounter (my order was pre-paid) with them during pickup, the staff was friendly.

Second issue: Most Asian food places give you steamed rice in a separate "to go" container, so if for example, you order a curry dish, you get the curry item in a pint or quart container, and then you get steamed rice in a separate container, making for a total of two pints of food.   Sushi Hiro doesn't, and that means you're paying a pretty high price for about half the quantity of food you get at most other Asian take-out places.     I learned the hard-way this was the case with both items I ordered.

Third issue: The Curry Rice with Tofu was extremely bland.  I'm well-aware that tofu itself has no flavor, but I'm also well-aware that any decent curry *does* have both 'heat' & flavor. The curry from Sushi Hiro simply didn't.  Their menu did not give any options for curry spiciness.  

Fourth issue:  I saved the Teriyaki Don with Tofu item to eat today, and just did.  Same issue covered in #2, *and* because the steamed rice was mixed-in with the Teriyaki Don, in the 20 hours between when it was cooked & when I ate it, the teriyaki sauce had been completely absorbed by the rice, thus the tofu and other ingredients didn't really have any of the Teriyaki flavor.    On top of that, the teriyaki flavor was minimal, so this dish also tasted very bland, just like my other entree from them!

  I've got zero reason to ever go back there (other than to ask for a refund), and even writing this negative --but completely honest-- review of the place is taking up more of my time than they deserve.

The sushi is AMAZING. It's fresh, good selection, and a great atmosphere. Serving sizes are excellent. All of that is irrelevant after the customer service me and my wife just received.  The credit/debit machine was down. We were given two options: 1) drive a mile down the road to an ATM to get cash for the bill, or 2) they would WRITE DOWN my card info (number, expiration, and security code) and manually run it after the server came back up. Obviously, I went to the ATM, paid the additional fee, and 20 minutes later was back with my wife (who I had to leave at the restaurant so we didn't skip on the check) to pay the bill. No discount offered. The ENTIRE meal should have been free. It is not my fault your equipment is malfunctioning. To ask a customer to leave their credit card info written down!? Get out of here.
This place is good. The taste and the presentation of the sushi is exceptional. The atmosphere is fun. I only wish that they are an all you can eat restaurant.

Checked out this place with my coworker after a long day at work. It's conveniently right next door to a place I've been going to for a long time, taco y taco.  After walking in we were immediately greeted and seated. As we looked through the menu I could tell that they were consistently trying to pressure us to get our order, even though we were told that we still had 30 min till final call for last food orders. This was the only thing that made me demote what would have been a perfect meal. The sushi was delicious, for both my end and my coworkers. I had gotten the "World Series" roll for approximately $15.

I honestly thought I didn't get my bank for my buck here. I spent $30 on 2 rolls and wished I got all you can eat immediately. The rolls sounded good but didn't taste THAT great for how expensive it was. BUT, it wasn't terrible!

This is our new favorite sushi place. The fish is so fresh, and the selections rotate. We highly recommend the o-toro, it melts in your mouth. The service is also excellent, prompt, efficient and so friendly.  We have moved away from ordering special rolls, so I cannot change comment on those, but the sashimi and sushi is where its at for us. And our wonderful waitress turned is on to fresh wasabi, and wow!! So good.
Thia place es super delicioso ! Real sushi ! And the menu have pictures !!! Awesomeee , shishitos son lo maximo !
Walked in, nice, quite, inviting place. We were greated by the entire staff (Which tends to be common in sushi places but always appreciated). Food was great sushi was fresh.

Hats off to the chef! By far one of my best experiences in Las Vegas! Friendly staff members and their professionalism was extraordinary! Fresh sashimi and sushi, quiet warm and quaint atmosphere, and great sake made my experience here unforgettable~ the Hirame was to die for!!

The rolls are H U G E! Complimentary poke which was a nice start. I used the free dessert from my check in for the tempura ice cream and it was delicious. I wouldn't go as far as saying it was the best sushi or even 5 star sushi, because I have had better. I don't know if they have all you can eat but I wasn't offered it if they do. The service was what was most incredible and its close to home so I'm sure I'll be back.

No detail is overlooked at this establishment.  The meal started with edamame heated to the perfect temperature with just the right amount of salt.  The ample portion of seaweed salad came with a swan carved from a lemon.  The highlight was the delicious nigiri sushi, beautifully presented.  The rolls were wonderful as well.  The service was impeccable and the environment is relaxing.  No better place to eat before catching a flight out of town.

We were expecting OMG sushi according to the reviews BUT... We got just OK sushi, close to the supermarket quality. Maybe I just expected too much. The portion is standard size. We ordered a Dragon Roll and a Plum Roll, and Yellowtail Caprcaccio. The yellowtail carpaccio was pretty good but the rolls, especially dragon was very average quality...not recommended

Great food, will be a regular spot. 

Got the Sashimi Dinner, was some of the best fish I've had in Vegas. I'm getting emotional just thinking about that salmon... Wife got the Dinner Bento with beef negimaki, another great option. They don't skimp either, all the portions were bigger than expected. 

We also ordered two rolls which were delicious and enormous. For the price of a standard roll elsewhere in town you get what is easily twice the amount. In the end it was almost too much for just three people...

Dinner came with a great miso soup and side salad with a very nice ginger dressing. Service was great, highly attentive. Try the shishito pepper appetizer, they are roasted and seasoned to perfection.

Forget the calamari not great. The garlic edamame was good. Don't order the red dragon if you really want to see any real soft she'll crab we never saw any. The out of control roll was good. I want to give  this place another chance
The lunch chirashi had generous portions. Nigiri was delicious. Presentation of food was beautiful! Friendly staff and quick service.
Great atmosphere, some of the most unique rolls over had in Vegas... Tasty as all get out, on top of that, there is a free dessert special going on for the grand opening. We will be back soon!

A visit to Sushi Hiro was at the top of my list since I was dying to complete my imaginary "Chef Hiro" omakase trilogy.  Unsure as to why three of the standout off the strip sushi restaurants are all spearheaded by such talented chefs with the same name (Sushi Hiroyoshi, Tokyo Boys are the other two), but I plan on legally changing my name to Hiro for a couple of weeks to see if that raises my own culinary game.

Prior to arrival, we called to discover that their corkage fee was a ridiculously low $7 (?!?!?!?) and snagged a couple of bottles at Trader Joe's up the street, which enhanced dinner smaaaashingly.  This is also the most price accessible Japanese spot offering omakase, starting at $49, but we opted for the $89 premium option and were seated in front of Chef Hiro himself in order to compare it fairly with the others...and because I am a fucking pig.  
  
While Raku's version of tofu is the gold standard for Las Vegas, the one that the Chef Hiro doles out is excellent and would save any Henderson resident some car fuel if they were jonesing for a soy fix.  The tempura dish, the other option for this specific course, was also first-rate.

The ocean trout sashimi was definitely a highlight, cut thick and delicious; these mini filets had me absolutely fish-giddy.  Served on a bed of crushed ice with several other cuts of sashimi and a mini-box of uni (kawaiiiiiii), it was easy to see that the chef and his staff take great pride in details.

All the nigiri served was terrific with the most unique being the special chu-toro from Massachusetts of all places.  This provided a unique flavor and chew; almost like a cross between ika and maguro...even in color!  Overall, this was another noteworthy dining experience that I would gladly return to.

4.12777492739204 stars!

We stumbled into this restaurant purely by accident and we were so glad we gave it a try! Immediately after being seated, the server gave us warm towels ... wow!  What a treat! 

The FRESHNESS and QUALITY = A+! 
Service = A
Parking = B (Not their fault;Parking is limited with all the stores in the shopping center)

There are a LOT of sushi restaurants in Henderson to chose from and this place will definitely be our 1st choice now!  Keep up the good work, Chef Hiro-San!

Best japanese restaurant ever!!! I would definitely recommend you guys!!! My husband is a half japanese and he is very amazed with the food, service and everything!!! We've been looking and trying different japanese restaurant here in Las Vegas, and finally we have found the most authentic japanese cuisine here in town :) Good thing, this place is just 1 mile away from our house. Will keep on coming back!!

I've been on a hunt for a good Japanese curry (karei raisu) on this side of town for a while, and Sushi Hiro delivered! It was a great, nearly-authentic Japanese experience and I can't wait to go back. 

When we first walked in, all the staff gave a hearty "Irasshaimase!" - "Welcome!" - which was a good sign. After we were seated, we were given hot towels (o-shibori) for washing our hands, another tradition you see in Japan but not so much in Japanese restaurants here. Two for two for hitting the "authentic" Japanese restaurant experience!

While we knew what we wanted, we looked over the menu and ended up ordering a baked asparagus appetizer as well. It was tasty and a nice starter to the bowls of curry heading our way. And man, were we happy when the curry hit the table. I had the torikatsu (fried chicken cutlet) with it, and at first I though the chicken alone was a little bland and needed more salt, but then I had it with the curry sauce, it was perfect. And man, that curry sauce. Unbelievable, with the flavors of the vegetables coming through beautifully, but all in perfect balance. Curry carving: blown away. 

As far as the restaurant, it's a nice modern looking place, with a few well-chosen Japanese decorations. Clean and uncluttered. Relaxing, but not fancy. 

There were only a few things that kept this from feeling like you were sitting in a restaurant in Japan: No doorbell buttons on the table - but it is an American restaurant, after all, and the wait staff were all very attentive so no need for the bells; and the contemporary pop on the radio. And the whole "everyone speaking English" bit ;)

Overall, REALLY excited to have a great curry place close by, I can't wait to come back and try some of the sushi!

This place used to be really good, but has gone downhill. The quality of the fish has decreased, the place always smells like sewage, and they can't even get simple requests correct. For example, I ask for easy rice, and I get extra rice. Mistakes like This might be tolerable when paying 5 bucks for a burger, but not when paying 50 bucks for 3 sushi rolls.

Authenticity: I like that this is a Japanese owned business, however the reason I don't give it 5 stars is because of areas of inauthenticity, such as in the bento box, the gyoza was fried and it also had egg rolls (weird). Also, I felt the slices of sashimi were too thick. I'm happy that this is NOT AYCE as I find that a disgusting concept. 

Food: chirashi, sashimi lunch and chicken katsu bento. quality was there, but too thick slices felt cumbersome in terms of mouth feel. I like that the chirashi came with pickles. It would be nice if they served complimentary orange slices at the end to get rid of the fish taste in my mouth. 

Service: very friendly and welcoming. 

I think I would be back to try bento box lunch again. In terms of Tokyo-style sushi, in Henderson, I still prefer Tokyo Boys.

Happened upon Sushi Hiro on our way for a taco dinner.  Surprised my husband suggested we try this new restaurant since he is very leery about eating sushi anywhere other than by the beach. We were greeted with a Japanese welcome by the entire staff when we walked in the door. We decided to sit at the bar for the "sushi bar" experience. We would have been happy at any other seat in the restaurant. The atmosphere was bright, clean and modern. Every dish we ordered was delicious: several sushi varieties, sticky rice, fried calamari, soup, gyoza, and lots of saki. Their sushi presentation is A+++. I would definitely recommend Sushi Hiro to anyone. Another indication of a good restaurant is the restroom - which was clean and modern. As we left, we were sent off with a Japanese goodbye from all the staff.
Yummy fresh sushi but the way the sushi chef yells at the waitresses is bothersome even if you don't know what they're saying.  Makes the whole experience less appealing.

This has to be one of the best sushi restaurants I've found around the Silverado Ranch area. I'll start with two negatives so you can read them and forget them - there is no all you can eat, and the prices are a bit prohibitive from eating there every night (it's a travesty - trust me).

NOW ON TO THE GOOD STUFF! The restaurant is cozy but laid out well - there are booths which actually offer slight privacy with tasteful curtains and then you have general table seating as well as front-row seats at the bar. The staff is very engaging and accommodating - many members of the team take the time to check in regarding drinks or clearing the table for you so you never have to worry about being unnoticed. 

The sushi chefs are especially talented at making some AMAZING rolls and adding their flare with some outstanding specialty rolls. While I can't consume shellfish, I still enjoy most everything on the menu because they are more than happy to accommodate a substitution and ensure zero cross contamination (seeing as I haven't visited the hospital yet - don't worry, yelp review once I do). 

One of my favorites is the out of control roll - just like everything else on the menu, it's a well sized portion which leaves you full yet ready for another. 

This is a must see!

First time eating here and I was pleasantly surprised, the atmosphere is clean and friendly staff with prompt service.

Located in the same shopping mall as Twin Peaks, BJ's, etc off Eastern. The restaurant is very clean, welcoming and friendly staff, and excellent food. Reminds me of Yummy Grill and Sushi off Lake Mead, but nicer.

I ordered a bottle of sake, and it came with an ice bucket to keep it cold. That's pretty cool. The menu has a wide variety of dishes, sushi, sashimi, bento boxes, etc. Ordered a rainbow roll, beef negi wegi, and one of the specials for the day, albacore tataki. All were presented nicely, tasted fresh and delicious. Very happy with the quality of the food here.

What really made it great was the service. We were frequently checked up on, empty plates taken away quickly, sake glass filled, my friends coke filled, and waters topped off at least 3-4 times. 

Its not a huge place, I think I counted 4 booths, and about 6 tables as well as the sushi counter. It was pretty full except for the counter when we dined here on a Wednesday evening 6pm. Well worth a visit, come check it out!!

Very Yummy and Fresh! The atmosphere and service is great too! Highly recommend this place. Good size rolls and great dessert. My favorite was the red bean mochi ice cream.

For the LV valley, Sushi Hiro offers some of the best quality sushi for the price.  The Uni is simply amazing.  Give this place a try if you're tired of the AYCE scene.

So far, I've been here about 10 times and this place is consistently great.  Their customer service is top notch also.

Sushi Hero has many 5 star reviews so expectations were high, unfortunately we were totally underwhelmed. Everyones tastes are different but Yelp is about honest reviews and that is what I will write. We arrived around 5:30 and were quickly greeted and seated in a booth. 

I started off with an ice cold Kirin draft while looking at the menu. There are no complimentary appetizers or salads like many other sushi or japanese restaurants (edamame, green salad with ginger dressing, cucumber salad, etc). We put an order in for a few different rolls and nigiri sushi. 

All of the order with the exception of the crazy tuna roll was served in the boat which was a really cool presentation. We first tried the yellowtail sushi was fine, pretty thin cut but average. We then went to the eel roll and both looked at each other as we ate it. The eel was very fishy tasting which fish should never be. The rice was cold and hard (like if you have ever had sushi from a supermarket). We did not finish the roll. 

We then tried the philly roll, spicy tuna and crazy tuna rolls and again did not care for them at all. The spicy tuna was very "dry" and again all of the rice was hard instead of warm and soft.

In all fairness this is more of a traditional sushi restaurant so maybe it just wasn't our taste. Maybe it was an off night? Im not sure but its definitely not like us to not finish our sushi. 

Our waitress noticed we didn't finish our food and asked why we didn't like it. We explained the eel was very fishy and she told us they switched to a new supplier and that might have been the issue. She was kind enough to take the eel roll off the bill. Everyone was very friendly and service was good but I cannot give more than 2 stars due to the sushi.
Just visiting the Vegas area and found this place on our travels. SOOOoooo glad we stopped. Great food, great dessert, service was amazing. Awesome place to eat if you love sushi.

Sushi is Sushi if made right with fresh Sushi quality fish. The thing is with all the "All You Can Eat"sushi places around people tend to forget that preparing this wonderful artistically prepared food takes a delicate hand and meticulous preparation and choosing of quality ingredients. That is where Hiro comes in. One glance at how he handles your food and prepare your food is art in motion. Nothing that we tried tonight from appetizer to desert comes short of being excellent. The prices are also very reasonable and generous. They also will accommodate you for half roll orders so you can try more on the selection and they are all worth trying. Sushi Hiro will be number one on my list. ICHIBAN !!!
 
05/22/16
Back here for lunch cause I cannot wait longer to try Hiro's other specialties. Today i tried the Chirasi lunch and the serving is so sumptuous and generous I think I am not eating dinner to have my palate remember how good it is. Hiro had me try his baked salmon sushi and it was so good without any hint of fishiness but the fresh quality taste of Salmon cut delicately and baked.

The best sushi bar in Las Vegas if you're looking for a new regular spot.  It's authentic (The owners are from Fukuoka) and the fish is top notch and flown in from Japan. You can get fish here that is simply not available at 95% of the sushi bars in town.  They do try to accommodate American/Las Vegan tastes with a large special roll menu, but do yourself a favor and order some fresh chu toro nigiri, kumamoto oysters, giant clam sashimi, etc. Their homemade tofu is a treat as well. 

This place is not all you can eat and hopefully Vegas learns that that is a GOOD THING if you're looking for real, quality sushi. Sushi Hiro could compete with the better joints in southern California.
